Description: This zippy, laser-edged auslese offsets luminous tangerine, white peach and honeydew flavors against an electric jolt of lime and lemon acidity. Profoundly ripe yet sprightly on the palate, it's a honeyed, sun-drenched sip cut by shards of crystal and slate. Buoyant fruit and heady perfume makes it irresistible young but it will continue to improve for decades.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Zilliken 2019 Rausch Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: This remarkable wine displays breathtaking power and elegance. Sourced from the sun-drenched cliffs of the Erdener Prälat, it's a massively ripe yet dry wine, packed with yellow peach and honey. Aged 24 months on lees, it's luscious and gripping on the palate yet maintains a steely spine of acidity. The finish feels endless and smoky. Delicious now–2035.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Erdener Prälat Réserve Alte Reben Dry GG
Name: Dr. Loosen 2014 Erdener Prälat Réserve Alte Reben Dry GG Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Struck flint and river rocks introduce this brilliantly steely dry Riesling. Compared to the youthful, almost tropical, charm of the producer's 2019 Herrenberg GG, lime and grapefruit flavors in the Abtsberg are bracing and linear in youth but suggest a depth and elegance that should reward cellaring. Best to hold till 2024 at least. It should evolve wonderfully through 2035 and hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maximin Grünhäuser 2019 Abtsberg GG Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Sourced from volcanic soils, this is a smoldering, intensely mineral wine highlighted by streaks of lime and lemon. It's piercing and concentrated in pure, pristine citrus flavors but powerful and sinewy on the finish. This bold dry Riesling that should reach peak from 2023 and improve well through 2040.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Bockenauer Stromberg GG Dry Gold Cap
Name: Schäfer-Fröhlich 2018 Bockenauer Stromberg GG Dry Gold Cap Riesling (Nahe)

Description: A rare expression of red-slate soils from the Pfalz, this dry, richly textured Riesling balances piercing gooseberry and grapefruit flavors against a rambling backdrop of scorched earth and spice. Zesty and penetrating, it's a stately wine that deserves a few more years of cellaring to show its full color. At peak from 2023–2040 but likely to hold longer as well.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ökonomierat Rebholz 2018 Kastanienbusch GG Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: The Herrenberg vineyard historically played second fiddle to the estate's more famed Abtsberg, but with shifting climactic conditions, GG wines from this vineyard are showing an intensity of fruit and mineral vitality that rivals its sibling bottlings. While slim in profile, this is a penetrating, reverberating sip packed with scintillating tangerine, yellow peach and nectarine flavors. Dry and breathtakingly balanced, it's a wine that should improve through 2035 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maximin Grünhäuser 2019 Herrenberg GG Riesling (Mosel)

Description: This dry bottling from its famed Saarburger Rausch vineyard, this is a sleek, hauntingly concentrated wine. While light in body, it's a ripe, almost cream-textured Riesling layered with luscious white peach, grapefruit and gooseberry flavors. Reflective of the vintage, it's a distinctly richer, more extracted expression of the Saar, yet maintains a steely, earthen edge. Approachable now but should improve through 2035 and hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Zilliken 2019 Rausch GG Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Heady notes of grapefruit and yellow apples perfume this full-bodied, richly concentrated Riesling. Dry in style and lusciously textured, it's a deeply satisfying, penetrating white that finishes long on a streak of bristling lemon acidity and a grip of orange pith. Tasted at the beginning of 2021, it's still fresh and fruity but should continue to develop well through 2035 and hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Iphöfer Julius-Echter-Berg GG Trocken Gold Cap
Name: Hans Wirsching 2016 Iphöfer Julius-Echter-Berg GG Trocken Gold Cap Riesling (Franken)

Description: Intensely smoky, spicy notes of crushed slate and sunbaked earth introduce this steely, muscular dry Riesling. Full bodied and voluminous on the palate, it's a silken, deeply textured white concentrated with zesty grapefruit, lime and lemon flavors. Deeply complex and bristling with energy, it's a wine that needs time to meld. Hold till 2024 at least. It should welcome cellaring well through 2040.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Monzinger Frülingsplätzchen GG Dry Gold Cap
Name: Schäfer-Fröhlich 2018 Monzinger Frülingsplätzchen GG Dry Gold Cap Riesling (Nahe)

Description: Streaks of white grapefruit and struck slate collide on the nose of this blindingly pure-fruited spätlese. Light on its feet yet powerfully concentrated with lime, apricot and honeydew flavors, it's an electric sip that can't be placed anywhere but the Mosel. Medium sweet yet without a trace of sugariness, it's irresistible now but should evolve beautifully through 2035 and hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Zilliken 2019 Rausch Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Piquant whiffs of smoke and spice accent gleaming yellow peach and nectarine in this decadently sunny yet slender dry Riesling. While medium in body, the palate is richly textured. This intensely fruity wine is welcoming young but steely and structured enough to allow it to gain complexity and depth through 2035 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Wehlener Sonnenuhr Alte Reben GG Trocken
Name: Dr. Loosen 2018 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Alte Reben GG Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Red-slate cliffs of the Erdener Treppchen are known for intensely smoky, iron-edged wines and this piercing dry Riesling is a classic expression. Nectarine and peach flavors are concentrated but cutting, struck by a zesty spine of acidity and a spicy, earthen finish. Tasted in January 2021 it's a bit nervous still but should meld and improve through 2035 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Erdener Treppchen Trocken Alte Reben GG
Name: Dr. Loosen 2018 Erdener Treppchen Trocken Alte Reben GG Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Crystalline strikes of crushed slate and mineral accent this piercing, sun-struck spätlese. Medium sweet on the palate yet pertly balanced by spine-tingling lime acidity, it's an intensely fruity, tropical sip that explodes with mango, honeydew and passion fruit flavors. Light as a feather and endless on the finish, it's at peak now through 2035 but will hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maximin Grünhäuser 2019 Abtsberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Powerfully ripe yet luminous and pristine, this stunning spätlese balances the richness of a monumentally ripe vintage with grace and vitality. Deeply penetrating white-peach and grapefruit flavors are accented by a spray of crushed slate and salt, as well as a piercing lemon-lime backbone. It's hedonistic now but should gain complexity and depth as it ages. At peak now through 2035.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Robert Weil 2019 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Spätlese Grosse Lage Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: There's a crystalline purity that sets apart wines from the Ganz Horn and the 2018 vintage GG is no exception. Dry and voluminous in body, its grapefruit and lime flavors are gleaming on the palate, edged by shards of salt and cut slate. The finish is endlessly long and honed by a quivering touch of steel. While delicious already, it's a wine that should shine from 2023–2040.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ökonomierat Rebholz 2018 Ganz Horn GG Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Notes of nectarine and apricot are cutting and spry in this full-bodied but vital, rejuvenating dry Riesling. Tasted young, it's gloriously fresh and fruity, etched by streaks of lime acidity and a dazzling mineral undertow. Through 2035 and likely longer, it's a wine that should gain intensity, earthen complexity and texture.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Haag 2019 Brauneberger Juffer Sonnenuhr Trocken GG Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Deep ripples of smoke and spice permeate through this smoldering dry Riesling. Packed with bristling lemon and grapefruit flavors, its palate is rich in texture yet steely and firm on the backbone. Tasted in early 2021, it's nervous and demure in youth but should gain nuance and depth from 2023 and evolve beautifully through 2035 and beyond.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Ürziger Würzgarten Alte Reben GG Dry
Name: Dr. Loosen 2018 Ürziger Würzgarten Alte Reben GG Dry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Pristine gooseberry and white grapefruit introduce this pure-fruited spätlese. While delicate in frame, it's a powerfully concentrated, penetrating semisweet wine that balances brilliant lemon, lime and white peach against a dazzling mineral backbone. It's juicy and exuberant in youth but should stay at peak through 2030 and gain more earthen, savory complexities thereafter.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Haag 2019 Brauneberger Juffer Sonnenuhr Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: While full bodied and delightfully creamy in texture, there's a freshness and delicacy in this blossomy, perfumed white. Lime and white-peach flavors are scintillating and pure, accented by strikes of crushed stone and a long, salty finish. It feels a bit subtle in youth but should gain depth as it improves. Best to hold through 2023 at least, it should improve well past 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domdechant Werner 2019 Kirchenstück GG Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Cooling, crystalline mineral tones accent crisp grapefruit and white peach-flavors here. Sourced from blue-slate soils of the Graacher Himmelreich, it's a svelte but silky, almost cream-textured wine structured by firm acidity and a long, steely finish. It's approachable already but should improve through 2035 at least and hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Graacher Himmelreich Alte Reben Trocken GG
Name: Dr. Loosen 2018 Graacher Himmelreich Alte Reben Trocken GG Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Piercing lemon and crushed slate introduce this bright, bristling Riesling sparkling. Fermented via traditional method and aged on its lees for 20 months, it balances pristine, luminous lime and lemon flavors against a delicate, creamy mousse and a dramatic mineral undertow. Dry in style and likely to stay at peak through 2030, it's a fantastic bargain for a wine of such elegance and style.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Von Buhl 2017 Brut Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Dusty slate and earth tones mingle into luscious guava and pink-grapefruit flavors in this decadently fruity kabinett. A sumptuous semi-dry Riesling, it's profoundly ripe and deeply concentrated but zippy and spry, finishing on a long, honeyed streak of lime and lemon acidity. Delicious young but should hold well through 2035.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2019 Berncasteler Doctor Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Notes of spice and crushed earth abound in this intensely ripe but classic expression of the red-slate slopes of Ürziger Würzgarten. Delicately sweet and delightfully tropical, it balances rich, ripe melon and pineapple flavors against a zippy spine of lemon acidity. The finish is long and smoky. Delicious in youth but should evolve beautifully through 2035 and hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Loosen 2019 Ürziger Würzgarten Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Intensely floral aromas introduce a concentrated wine with lush flavors of Cosmic Crisp apple, banana cream, lemon custard and marshmallow. It's spicy and deep, yet finished dry. Sourced from nearly 50-year-old vines, this wine is a rare treasure.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2018 Maresh Vineyard Old Vine Riesling (Dundee Hills)

Description: While the nose is stony and subtle, the palate of this profoundly ripe, rich auslese pulsates with sun-drenched white-peach and honeydew flavors. It's delectably sweet yet gloriously pure in fruit profile and balanced by a crush of lime acidity. Delightful young but powerful enough to mature well through 2035 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2019 Bernkasteler Badstube Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Light as a feather yet piercing and powerful, this zippy spätlese juxtaposes luminous gooseberry and white-peach flavors against streaks of lime and cut stone. Medium sweet in style, it's an intensely ripe yet breathless, cutting wine that finishes long and pure. It is delicious already but should improve through 2035 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Loosen 2019 Erdener Treppchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Salty, smoky notes of crushed earth and clay mingle into bright, sun-kissed peach and grapefruit here. Tasted alongside its sibling bottling, the Kirchenstück Erste Lage Trocken, it's impossible to decide which is better, but the Domdechaney suggests a spicier, smokier intensity that's seductive. A touch of lime pith lingers long on the finish. Ready to drink now but should improve through 2030 and likely hold much longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domdechant Werner 2019 Hochheim Domdechaney Erste Lage Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Pretty notes of spring blossom and sugar cookies introduce this intensely perfumed, floral white. Dry and voluptuously textured in style, it balances luminous, intensely concentrated lemon and white-grapefruit flavors against a steely backbone of acidity. Compared to the producer's flagship Kirchenstück GG, it offers an ease and juiciness that's delightful young but this is also a wine that should drink beautifully through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domdechant Werner 2019 Hochheimer Kirchenstück Trocken Erste Lage Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Seductive notes of petrichor and struck slate introduce this svelte, green-fruited sip. There's just a whisper of sweetness here rounding out electric shocks of lime acidity and a lean, steely finish. It's delicious young but should stay at peak through 2027 at least hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Haag 2019 Brauneberger Juffer Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Long associated with Chehalem Winery, this old vine site makes a wonderful Riesling. It's finished dry despite the low alcohol, with a mix of both skin and fruit flavors including apple, pear and lemon. A mineral underpinning adds focus and length.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Élevée Winegrowers 2017 Corral Creek Vineyard Riesling (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: Profoundly ripe flavors of yellow cherry and peach have a smouldering, smoky undertone in this concentrated medium-sweet Riesling. It's a gorgeously ripe, fruity sip struck by sunny lemon and tangerine acidity. Best enjoyed young to maximize its piercing fruit profile but it's structured enough to drink well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Cardinal Cusanus Stiftswein Brauneberger Juffer Sonnenuhr Spätlese
Name: Weingut Stiftung St. Nikolaus-Hospital 2019 Cardinal Cusanus Stiftswein Brauneberger Juffer Sonnenuhr Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: A crush of earth and salty minerals introduces this luminous, almost crystalline sip. Just a hint off dry, it offers piercing, sun-drenched flavors of white peach and honeydew against a spine-tingling backbone of lime and lemon. Effortless and thirst quenching, it's an irresistible wine in youth but structured enough to hold beautifully through 2030 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Zilliken 2019 Saarburg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: This feather-weight auslese surprises from nose to finish with its bold, blossomy perfume and richly concentrated peach and honey palate. While medium sweet and gloriously ripe it's balanced by zingy strikes of lime and lemon acidity as well as a cool, steely tang that lengthens the finish. Lovely in youth but should gain earthen complexities as it ages. It is at peak now through 2035.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ulrich Langguth 2018 Harmonie Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: The nose is subtle here, suggesting traces of fresh lemon and blossom, but the palate of this dry, full-bodied white offers juicy, mouthwatering white-peach and grapefruit flavors edged by a crush of stony minerals and a pleasant tug of lime zest. While immediately enjoyable, it's a steely, elegantly structured Riesling that should improve through 2030 and hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Robert Weil 2019 Kiedrich Turmberg Trocken Erste Lage Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Luminous white peach and cherry blossoms perfume this dry, gorgeously fruity white. While medium bodied in style, it's a lavish, silky Riesling etched by a fine filigree of chalk and slate. Fresh-faced and pristine in fruit, it appeals to a wide audience but it's a remarkably elegant wine that should drink well through 2025 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Robert Weil 2019 Kiedricher Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: A crush of stony mineral notes accents deep, penetrating tangerine and yellow-cherry flavors in this pure, crystalline spätlese. Medium-sweet but calibrated neatly with a spine-tingling frame of acidity, it's a light-bodied, zippy white that's delicious now but should continue to drink well at peak through 2030 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domdechant Werner 2019 Hochheimer Hölle Spätlese Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: This zingy kabinett is such an irresistible lightning bolt of Riesling. While subtle and mineral on the nose, the palate jolts with lime, yellow-peach and tangerine flavors struck by tangs of salt and slate. Light in body yet piercing in style, it finishes long on a murmur of spice and earth. It's hard not to drink this one immediately but it should hold through 2030 as well.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Loosen 2019 Ürziger Würzgarten Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Sun-drenched yellow-cherry and apricot notes extend from nose to palate in this deeply concentrated yet fresh-fruited spätlese. Zippy and spry, it pulsates with rich, ripe peach and tangerine flavors as well as a smoky, lingering finish. This decadent medium-sweet wine is drinking beautifully now but should hold through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Loosen 2019 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Bold notes of honey and hibiscus nectar sweeten this piercing medium-sweet Riesling. Light as a feather and packed with scintillating yellow-peach and lemon flavors, it's a zesty auslese edged by lingering notes of tea leaf and bee pollen. While tasty already, it's a wine that will likely hit peak from 2022–2037.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Mönchhof 2017 Erdener Prälat Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Smoky notes of crushed slate and burnt caramel lend complexity to bristling tangerine and nectarine flavors in this zingy, thirst-quenching kabinett. There's just a kiss of sweetness that hits the midpalate before dissipating into a shock of lemony acidity and a glimmering mineral finish. It's delicious young but structured enough to improve well through 2035.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Reinhold Haart 2018 Piesporter Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Harvested a week earlier than GG wines and from younger vines on the Felseneck vineyard, the Schiefergestein is a more approachable, fresh-fruited expression of this producer's steely, mineral-focused style. Dry and refreshingly brisk, it offers sunny, pristine grapefruit and honeydew flavors catapulted by racy lime acidity and hints of cut slate. Ready to drink now but should hold through 2028.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schäfer-Fröhlich 2018 Schiefergestein Bockenauer Trocken Riesling (Nahe)

Description: Bold spice, crushed earth and dazzling tangerine, mango and peach penetrate from nose to finish here. Slight in frame yet piercing like a sabre, it's a zesty, intensely concentrated Riesling that finishes on a long, delicately sweet finish. It's rejuvenating in youth but should drink at peak through 2028 and likely hold much further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schäfer-Fröhlich 2018 Bockenauer Felseneck Kabinett Riesling (Nahe)

Description: Porphyr refers to large-grained crystals of igneous rock that penetrate the subsoil of the Grand Cru vineyards Höllberg and Heerkretz from where this stately wine originates. It's an intensely mineral wine that balances zesty lime and grapefruit flavors against a smouldering backdrop of earth. Voluminous on the palate and dry in style, it's an elegant, piercing white that should drink beautifully through at least 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wagner-Stempel 2018 Siefersheim Porphyr Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: There's just a hint of lime blossom on the nose but the palate of this vibrant kabinett pulsates with piercing lime and lemon flavors. Semisweet in style yet calibrated neatly by racy acidity and a cooling, mineral edge, it's a stately yet irresistibly quaffable sip best now through 2029.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Robert Weil 2019 Kabinett Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Light as a feather but deeply penetrating, this high-spirited kabinett zips and zaps with delicately sweet lime, lemon and white-peach flavors. Dusted by slate and edged by smoke and salt, it's a deeply mineral, sprightly wine that finishes on piercing acidity. Delicious young but should drink at peak through 2027 and hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2019 Bernkasteler Badstube Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Hits of white pepper, smoke and crushed slate lend spicy, earthen nuances to this sleek, slim Riesling. Dry and steely on the palate, the finish is softened by lingering streaks of fresh tangerine and lemon. At peak now through 2030 but should hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2019 Single Vineyard Ürziger Würzgarten Dry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: A crush of crystalline minerality and delicate spice mingle into luminous white peach and pineapple here. Intensely ripe yet gorgeously pure in fruit, it's a snappy, spine-tingling style of off-dry Riesling that's irresistible young but likely to maintain peak performance through 2027 and hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Loosen 2019 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Perfumed, sunny notes of mango, guava and honeydew lend tropical flair to this dry but intensely fruity Riesling. It's svelte and steely on the palate yet hedonistic and thirst quenching too, with a finish that's long and intently mineral. It's ready to drink now, but should hold well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Raimund Prüm 2019 Solitär Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Chiseled granite and crushed gravel aromas make for a very stony entry to the brilliant nose of this bottling, which also offers tight apple-peel scents. The palate sizzles with acidity and grips with mineral-driven tension, allowing struck stone, lemon-pith and lime-peel flavors to compete for deserved attention. Drink now through 2039.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2019 Rodney's Vineyard Riesling (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Mouthwatering honeydew and lemon flavors explode on the palate of this succulent medium-sweet Riesling. It's deeply fruity but luminous and fresh, balancing sweet, succulent nectar against streaks of steel and lime acidity. Delicious now but should hold well through 2025 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Robert Weil 2019 Spätlese Riesling (Rheingau)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the oldest site on Ribbon Ridge, this fine-tuned, well-crafted wine weaves together veins of lemon, grapefruit, peach, apricot and papaya. It's finished dry, but teeters on the edge of off-dry, with juicy acidity providing a perfect counterpoint. This would be an exceptional match to pork tenderloin with sautéed apples.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Élevée Winegrowers 2018 Ridgecrest Vineyard Riesling (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Marin County, North Coast, California, US
Description: This light-bodied, delicate wine made from nonirrigated old vines is fragrant in aromas of peach and apple blossom. The palate brings mint, pine, green apple and tangy white-peach flavors on a crisp, vibrant texture. Its complexity and elegance will be compelling for fans of the variety.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2018 Chileno Valley Vineyard Riesling (Marin County)

Description: Sylphlike in structure, this zesty dry Riesling offers a leaner, more delicate expression of the increasingly voluminous, intensely extracted GG style. Pristine white-grapefruit and lime flavors are brisk in concentration here and edged by delicate hints of salt and slate. Ready to drink now, it should hold through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ulrich Langguth 2019 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen GG Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Delicate notes of violet blossoms and smoke perfume this intensely ripe, fruity spätlese. Medium sweet yet invigorating on the palate, it's packed full of gobsmacking yellow-peach and tangerine flavors along with a bristling edge of steel. Delicious young but it should hold through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heyden 2019 Oppenheimer Sackträger Spätlese Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: Sun-struck yellow peaches and nectarines are dusted with slate and sea salt in this invigorating off-dry Riesling. Light on its feet and equal parts fruit and earth, it's a zesty, nuanced sip that finishes long and smoky. Ready now, but it should hold well through 2029.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Estate Bottled From Old Vines Gutswein
Name: St. Urbans-Hof 2019 Estate Bottled From Old Vines Gutswein Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Dry and intently steely, this is a svelte, medium-bodied Riesling studded with piercing lime and lemon flavors. Despite a ripe, ample vintage, it's a thrilling, racy white that finishes with a delightfully salty tang of chalk and slate. Best now through 2029.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ulrich Langguth 2019 Traben Gaispfad Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Flavors of yellow peach, pineapple and tangerine are bright and luscious in this sun-kissed Riesling. Semisweet yet balanced by zesty kicks of lemon and tangerine acidity, it's a juicy, immediately enjoyable sip edged by lingering notes of crushed slate and smoke. It is at peak now through 2029.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2019 Bernkasteler Badstube Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: The nose is demure here suggesting cooling notes of river rock and tart honeydew. But the palate of this zingy, light sabre of Riesling offers crisp white-peach and lemon flavors catapulted by a streak of lime acidity. It's a vital, spine-tingling sip that awakens the senses and then soothes through a long, steely finish. Delicious now but it should hold well through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Robert Weil 2019 Tradition Gutswein Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Graphite and smoke meander into lime and grapefruit throughout this boldly proportioned, voluminous white. Dry and full bodied, it's an intensely earthy, smouldering sip edged by hints of bitter saffron and pollen. The finish is long and steely. Best now through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Piesporter Domherr Best Lage Grosses Gewächs Gold Cap
Name: Weller-Lehnert 2018 Piesporter Domherr Best Lage Grosses Gewächs Gold Cap Riesling (Mosel)

Description: While quiet and earthen on the nose, there's an abundance of sun-drenched tangerine and nectarine flavors in this juicy, intensely fruity kabinett. Gloriously ripe yet balanced by zippy citrus acidity and a bite of orange pith, it's immediately enjoyable but should drink well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2019 Graacher Himmelreich Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: A delicate veil of struck slate and bee pollen lends an earthen subtlety to ripe yellow-peach and mango flavors here. Off dry and glazed with a touch of caramelized honey, it's a lip-smacking kabinett balanced by sunny tangerine acidity. Immediately approachable but should hold through 2030 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2019 Bernkasteler Badstube Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Whiffs of smoke and struck slate mingle into ripe, luminous honeydew and lime flavors in this lip-smackingly sweet yet racy Riesling. Light bodied and piercing on the palate, it finishes long and steely, lingering on hints of saffron and dusty earth. At peak now through 2035 but it will hold longer too.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ulrich Langguth 2019 Piesporter Günterslay Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: As Wagner-Stempel's entry-level bottling, this fresh, piercing white offers bold doses of the producer's signature smoky, earthen complexities balanced against strikes of sunny tangerine and lemon. Approachable in youth yet subtle and deeply nuanced, it's an elegant introduction to this unique, enduring style. Best now through 2028.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wagner-Stempel 2018 Gutswein Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: While dry in style, this joyously tropical white offers rich, concentrated flavors of guava, pineapple and mango calibrated by a lip smacking strike of lemon-lime acidity. Medium bodied yet voluminous in style, it's a brilliantly fresh, fruity sip in youth that should hold through 2024 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domdechant Werner 2019 Guts Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Hints of apple and yellow peach intensify from nose to palate in this deeply fruity medium-bodied Riesling. With barely a trace of perceptible sugar on the palate, it's a juicy, satisfying white that's likely to please a wide audience.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domdechant Werner 2019 Classic Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: There's a delicate copper tone that illuminates zesty tangerine and lemon in this intensely fruity, concentrated sip. Off dry and shrouded in a lacy veil of sweetness, it's a lip smacking, delightfully peachy kabinett offset by bracing lime acidity. Best now through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Von Buhl 2018 Armand Kabinett Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Cooling tones of struck flint and slate introduce this light-bodied, zippy dry Riesling. Packed with pristine white-grapefruit and lime flavors, it's a fresh-faced thirst-quenching white that should appeal broadly. Best enjoyed now through 2029.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ulrich Langguth 2019 Vom Urschiefer Trabener Gaispfad Reserve Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Shards of slate and lime introduce this very linear, steely white. Dry and svelte in body, it balances bracing lemon and tart tangerine flavors against a firm mineral undertow. A refreshingly slim, zesty expression of dry Mosel Riesling that's increasingly rare these days.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ulrich Langguth 2018 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen GG Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This forced-carbonated Riesling starts with rich aromas of apple, pear and pineapple on the nose. The frothy palate explodes in flavors of ripe orchard and tropical fruit, with pithy citrus tones providing balance. While fruity and forward, it's a well-balanced bubbly that would liven up any party.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Sheldrake Point 2019 Beta Series Bubbles Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Description: Alternating hits of lime and luscious honeydew introduce this decadently fruity, almost cream-textured Riesling. Off dry and penetrating with ripeness, it's a bolder, richer expression of kabinett that's to be expected in such a ripe vintage. Delicious young but it is concentrated enough to hold well through 2027 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domdechant Werner 2019 Hochheim Kabinett Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: From nose to finish, this is an intently mineral kabinett accented by tangs of struck flint and slate. Just a kiss off dry in style, it calibrates zesty white-grapefruit flavor against Margarita-like tangs of salt and lime. It's deliciously quaffable young but should meld nicely through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heyden 2019 Oppenheimer Kabinett Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: Zingy lemon and white flowers perfume this brisk, dry Riesling. Lean and steely on the palate, it's a pristine, intensely citrusy white edged by pleasant bites of lime and lemon peels. Delicious now but structured enough to hold well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Allendorf 2019 Save Water Drink Riesling Dry Riesling (Rheingau)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This traditional-method sparkling Riesling offers savory aromas of bread crust and blanched almond alongside seared lemon and fresh peach. It's rounded in feel on the palate, with expansive flavors that echo the nose. It shows lift, intensity and depth, with a cinched-up, dry finish that leaves you coming back for more.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Anthony Road 2016 Sparkling Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Description: Nectarine and yellow-peach flavors are thirst-quenching and brisk in this juicy, effortlessly pleasing Riesling. Off dry but balanced with peppy hits of lemon and lime acidity, it's a fresh-fruited apéritif or an elegant accompaniment for a weekday meal. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2019 Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean Meyer lemon cake aromas meet with a grapefruit edge on the rather opulent nose of this medium-sweet bottling. There's a flinty edge to the sip, which cuts through the slightly sugared and creamy orange flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2019 Riesling (Santa Barbara County)

Description: There's barely a whisper of discernible sweetness in this almost-dry Riesling. Light bodied and juicy, it's a concentrated sip of pristine white-peach and apricot flavors accented by zesty tangerine acidity. At peak now through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2019 Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Delicate pineapple and tangerine notes introduce this fully dry but slim, light-footed Riesling. Silken in texture and edged by steel, it's an elegant, freshly balanced white that should drink well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2019 Dry Riesling (Pfalz)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This Charmat-method sparkling Riesling offers bright aromas of yellow apple and nectarine on the nose. It's zesty and frothy on the palate, with brisk pome and stone fruit flavors shot through with crisp acidity. It's a tasty, fresh sparkling wine akin to Prosecco in style and flavor profile.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Empire Estate NV Blanc de Blancs Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hazy citron in the glass, this offers an explosion of fruity aromas: peach, apple, pear, lemon and a bit of banana. The palate is gently bubbly, with savory yeast and mixed fruit tones holding court. It's tasty for its short burst of intense, fruity energy.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Buttonwood Grove 2020 Pét-Nat Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intense aromas of butterscotch, lemon cream, mango and pineapple are rich, undulating and deep on the nose. The unctuous, sweet palate brings flavors of caramel-drizzled apple and dried apricot, with piercing acidity shooting through all that richness. There's incredible concentration, depth and length, making this a no-brainer for the cellar. Drink through 2035.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2017 Tango Oaks Ice Wine Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Concentrated aromas of yellow apple, pineapple, lemon oil and pine meld with a blossomy undertone in this Riesling sourced from a vineyard that dates to the 1970s. It's unctuously sweet on the palate yet well defined. Luscious orchard fruit is dappled in honey and lemon zest, with a real sense of energy and lift that persists through the lingering finish. Drink now–2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hermann J. Wiemer 2019 Josef Vineyard Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: From a blend of estate sites, this dry Riesling offers soothing aromas of peach, apricot, lavender and orchard blossom. It's sultry and creamy on the medium-bodied palate, but well honed by vibrant acidity. A blossomy tone lingers throughout, with a rich core of peach and apple struck against a gently pithy texture. Drink through 2028.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hermann J. Wiemer 2019 Reserve Dry Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Incredibly concentrated aromas of apple, pineapple, peach and lemon oil are detailed, precise and intense on the nose. The lusciously sweet palate echoes those tones and brings in gobs of lemon honey. There's immense lift and verve despite all the depth, making this one to hold for a bit in the cellar. Drink through 2035.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2019 Tango Oaks Ice Wine Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Incredibly zesty yet rich aromas of apple, lemon peel and chamomile dazzle on the nose of this single-vineyard wine. It's rounded and ripe in feel on the palate, yet immensely lifted by vibrant acidity. Juicy apple, peach and yellow blossom flavors never falter, with a delicate crushed stone element adding zip to the lingering finish. Drink through 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hermann J. Wiemer 2019 HJW Vineyard Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sourced from a Keuka Lake vineyard, this rich dry Riesling offers dense tones of tangerine, lemon oil, pine and dry honeycomb on the nose. There's immense breadth and body to the palate, where juicy shots of orange and apple push through the sultry texture. There's a delicate earthiness to it all, with a crushed slate minerality zipping along on the lingering finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Living Roots 2019 Shale Creek Bone-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Concentrated tones of apple, white grapefruit, citrus perfume and peach make for a deep well of aromas on the nose. There's real depth to the palate, where a gentle, pithy texture is lifted by juicy pome and stone fruit. It has almost an oily feel, yet that texture is quickly put to rest by the pervasive drive of the zesty acidity. It's one to sip, savor and, if you can, cellar. Drink now–2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hosmer 2019 Limited Release Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

Description: Tasmanian Riesling is underrated and under made. Those who do focus on it have a passion for the variety. Samantha Connew's version, from the Coal River Valley, is mouthwatering, with its refreshment belying its volume and layers. It weaves flavors of fresh lime, green apple, lavender, honey and beeswax into a chalky texture, crunchy acidity and just a touch of residual sugar. Ultra-food-friendly, this would be at home beside young, creamy cheeses or popped in the cellar for a few years to gain more textural weight and honeyed complexity.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Stargazer 2019 Coal River Valley Single Vineyard Riesling (Tasmania)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Made from grapes frozen on the vine and harvested in December 2017, this offers intense aromas of peach, pineapple, lemon curd, tangerine oil and a hint of white button mushroom. There's immense lift on the sultry, sweet palate, showing a beautiful mix of luscious, creamy fruit against sunny, bright lemon-soaked acidity. A drizzle of amber honey meets a final shot of citrus on the lingering close. Drink through 2033.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Weis 2017 Winzer Select Ice Wine Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Ripe yellow apple and Mirabelle plum aromas mix with crushed salt and apple blossoms on the nose of this dry Riesling. There's ample lift to the rounded palate, where crystalline acidity pushes through the ripe juicy fruit flavors. Pithy pomelo zest and earthy white tea flavors lend depth and linger on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: The Grapes of Roth 2019 Virgin Berry Dry Riesling (Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intensely coiled aromas of fresh lime, crushed stone and peach blossom give this single-vineyard wine a sense of vitality. Bright shots of lime, grapefruit and lemon are met with a juicy apple core on the dry palate, leading to a gently creamy texture on the lingering finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wagner 2019 Caywood East Vineyard Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Concentrated aromas of lemon oil, peach, pine and struck flint grace the nose of this single-vineyard Riesling. It's rounded and full in feel on the palate, filled out by juicy orchard fruit flavors yet expertly honed by zesty acidity and a delicate grip of white tea. A lemon oil tone lingers on the finish, but with ample lift and length.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hermann J. Wiemer 2019 Magdalena Vineyard Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intense aromas of lemon peel, shiso leaf and green apple swirl on the nose. There's a creamy, rounded feel to the medium-bodied palate, where coiled flavors of apple, lime and quince revolve around a stony core. It shows immense energy and lift. Drink through 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Fox Run 2019 Silvan Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sourced from vines planted in 1972, this striking dry Riesling delves into perfumed tones of peach, apple, jasmine and slate. There's richness to the palate yet immense lift and drive, with lasting acidity and crushed-stone verve pushing it along. It lingers long on a resounding citrus finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Standing Stone 2019 Timeline Dry Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Made from grapes at an Auslese level of ripeness and then fermented nearly dry, this offers an explosion of pineapple, star fruit, mango and grapefruit on the nose. It's full and rich in feel on the creamy palate, with billowy tropical fruit flavors honed by a pithy citrus peel note. It ends slightly hot but still within balance, making this a unique experiment from Winemaker Kelby Russell.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2017 Tango Oaks Vineyard Noble Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Well-concentrated aromas of apple and peach meld with crushed stone and yellow blossoms on the nose. There's a real sense of energy and lift to the deft palate, where juicy shots of tangerine and pome fruit are lifted by vibrant acidity. The fruit lingers on the finish but with substantial lift.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hermann J. Wiemer 2019 Dry Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's ample depth to the nose of this wine, showing lemon oil, crushed stone, yellow apple and ginger. It's semidry in style but impeccably balanced by plenty of zesty acidity. Juicy orchard fruit flavors are underscored by a tangy line of wet slate, making this utterly balanced and quite lengthy. Drink through 2026.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Fox Run 2019 Reserve Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lime skins, lemongrass, crisp pear and a hint of light apricot pop on the nose of this bottling. There's a viscous texture to the palate, where orange blossom, jasmine and light honey flavors align, leading into a waxy finish that's just the tiniest bit sweet.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cutruzzola 2017 Riven Rock Vineyard Riesling (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Perfumed aromas of apple and Meyer lemon meld with a delicate oolong tone on the nose of this dry Riesling. There's a rounded, pithy feel to the palate, where flavors of lemon, apple and apricot are wrapped in a mild grip of white tea tannins. This is a beautifully textured, pristine expression from a relatively young vineyard planted in 2007.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2015 Tango Oaks Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intense aromas of star fruit, pineapple and lemon oil are pure and pristine on the nose. The lusciously sweet palate brings flavors of pithy lemon and tropical fruit drizzled in orange-tinged honey. While there's ample richness, there's also plenty of piercing acidity to keep it lifted. Drink through 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Boundary Breaks 2018 Ice Wine Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe mango, papaya and pineapple jump from the glass, with zesty notes of tangerine and lime lending focus to all that richness. It's luscious on the palate but well defined. The blend of juicy tropical fruit and pithy citrus plays well together, with a lingering tart pineapple note extending on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hermann J. Wiemer 2019 Semi-Dry Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Perfumed aromas of lime peel, crushed stone and white blossoms dance on the nose of this graceful dry Riesling. There's a real sense of energy to the zippy palate, where zesty citrus peels mix with a tangy limestone element. While taut in feel, there's a pleasing textural grip that grounds it all.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: The Grapes of Roth 2019 Dry Riesling (Long Island)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pristine aromas of candied citrus peels, ripe apple and peach echo on the luscious palate, where gobs of honey drizzle the fruit flavors. Laser-like acidity lends immense lift to it all, while a gentle creaminess resounds throughout. It shows wonderful purity and detail, and will hold up well in the cellar. Drink through 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hermann J. Wiemer 2019 Late Harvest Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Perfumed aromas of peach, apple and pink grapefruit show incredible zest and spunk on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is dry in style, with bright, zesty pome and tangerine flavors wrapped in a delicate floral undertone. There's a creaminess to the feel that gives this great presence and length on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Keuka Spring 2019 Humphreys Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe aromas of white grape, pear and sugar-dusted blossoms carry the nose of this semisweet white. The palate is boisterous and juicy in lemon, pineapple and white grape flavors yet shot through with pulsing acidity. There's excellent depth and richness, with a lingering zestiness that leaves you coming back for more.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Atwater 2016 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright aromas of lemon and lime peels meld with white flowers and pear rind in this zesty dry Riesling. There's good weight to the medium-bodied palate, with persistent juicy orchard fruit flavors propped up by driven acidity. A gentle stoniness creeps in on the midpalate to ground it all, ending with a slightly pithy mouthwatering finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Weis 2019 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rounded aromas of yellow apple, Meyer lemon, peach and white tea offer a graceful start to this dry-style Riesling. There's an explosion of perfumed peach and pineapple on the palate, sitting on a silky texture and pushed along by pristine acidity. This is a well-concentrated, zesty pour.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Silver Thread 2019 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sourced from a vineyard on Seneca Lake, this wine offers a stony, earthy core surrounded by citrus and apple tones on the nose. The palate is broad and juicy yet dry in style, with honed lemon, pome fruit and crushed stone elements zipping along.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2019 Margrit Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Perfumed aromas of peach, apple and ginger mix with a citrus spray accent on the nose. There's a succulence to the gushing peach, pineapple and lemon flavors on the palate, with a gentle creaminess throughout, but all the while held in check by pristine acidity. This is a well-balanced offering that will please many with its affable personality.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hosmer 2019 Semi-Dry Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Perfumed aromas of lime, peach and apple meld with a stony core on the nose. The palate shows pollen-dusted orchard fruit drizzled in a light string of honey, balanced by ample bright acidity. There's very good concentration and lift to it all, with a lingering white blossom note on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Anthony Road 2019 Semi Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Jasmine and orchard blossom aromas perk up the nose of this semidry Riesling. It's zesty and crisp on the palate, where juicy peach and pineapple flavors explode with sunny intensity. There's lift and verve to it all, balanced by lime-tinged acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Keuka Spring 2019 Classic Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of radish and jicama give a fresh, earthy vibe to the nose, with a resounding lemon note at the core. The semidry palate offers sweet-tart flavors of apple, lemon and peach, with pithy grapefruit lending grip. There's nice lift and length on the finish that leaves you coming back for more.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Keuka Spring 2019 Wiltberger Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of struck flint, evolving into wet stone and lime. The white peach flavors drink bone-dry with absolutely electric acidity that snaps you to attention. It's hard to tell where the aroma are heading, but the palate is simply beautiful. Decant if drinking in the near term. Pair it with grapefruit mignonette.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2019 Underwood Mountain Vineyards Riesling (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Brisk aromas of crushed slate and lime meld with creamy pear on the nose of this off-dry Riesling. There's ample weight to the palate, where pithy citrus and yellow apple flavors are honed by a zesty lime-laden core.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Living Roots 2019 Off-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A delicate floral note rides above the juicy apple and peach core on the nose of this wine. While deft in feel, it shows rounded pome fruit flavors shot through with tangy white cherry. There's ample perfume and lift to it all, with a lingering talc dust finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Silver Thread 2019 Estate Vineyard Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pretty aromas of apple, peach and white blossoms meld with a lifted citrus backdrop in this semidry wine. It's rounded and juicy in feel on the palate, with bright orchard fruit flavors shot against sunny acidity. There's good drive and length, with a zesty, mouthwatering finish that leaves you coming back for more.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Weis 2019 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This semidry Riesling offers a deft mix of juicy apple and peach tones against a delicate white tea accent. Zesty orange-laden acidity lifts it all up, making this a well-balanced offering.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hunt Country Vineyards 2017 Reserve Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Luscious peach, apricot and pineapple aromas carry to the full-feeling palate. The mix of stone and tropical fruit flavors is delicious, with vibrant acidity lending ample lift. Sweet fruit echoes on the lingering finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Keuka Spring 2019 Semi-Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This is a well-balanced semidry Riesling that offers juicy tones of apple and yellow peach, lifted by lots of lemony zing. There's a richness to the fruit but also nice lift that gives this a crisp, refreshing finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lakewood 2019 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas pop, with notes of jasmine, lime, white peach and flower. Bone-dry Nestea lemon iced tea flavors follow. It delights.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2019 Dry Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intense aromas of lemon oil, furniture polish, apricot jam and oolong tea carry to the pithy, unctuous palate. There's good depth and richness to the flavors, with plenty of racy acidity to lift it all up.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Zugibe 2018 Late Harvest Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intense aromas of lime peels, fresh thyme and kerosene carry to the medium-bodied palate. A slightly candied citrus peel flavor chimes in, but a pithy texture and a savory note of crushed salt lend ample balance. It ends dry, savory and lifted, delivering a zesty Riesling that will play well at the dinner table.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Anthony Road 2019 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A delicate perfume of peach blossom, apple and citrus spray gently wafts from the glass. There's focus to the zesty citrus and pome fruit flavors on the light-bodied palate, with a mild pithy texture lending grip. This dry Riesling deftly balances juicy fruit in a taut frame.                      Alexander Peartree
Designation: Small Batch Series Corey Creek Vineyard
Name: Bedell 2019 Small Batch Series Corey Creek Vineyard Riesling (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rounded aromas of peach and apple show ample concentration on the nose. The palate is bright in juicy orchard fruit flavors, with a tangy, pithy lemon peel note grounding it all. It ends brisk and zesty, making this easy to enjoy as an aperitif.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wagner 2019 Semi Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: From a vineyard planted in 1999, this offers ripe apple and sugar-dusted flowers on the nose alongside candied citrus and ginger. The medium-dry palate boasts a rounded feel, with juicy orchard fruit flavors lifted by shots of grapefruit and tangerine. This shows nice lift and length.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Buttonwood Grove 2019 Riemer Block Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rich aromas of tangerine and apricot meld with sharper tones of lime and thyme on the nose. There's nice weight and depth to the medium-bodied palate, where juicy yet pithy orchard fruit flavors are propped up by zesty acidity. While fruity in nature, the balance is there, making this easy to enjoy as an aperitif.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2019 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Perfumed aromas of peach, apple and lemon meld with a delicate pine oil backdrop in this dry Riesling. There's ample concentration and verve to the juicy orchard fruit on the palate, with a pithy texture and zesty acidity lending balance. It's a delicious offering from this Cayuga Lake estate.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Sheldrake Point 2019 Dry Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's nice density to the aromas of lime peel, canned peach and fresh snap peas on the nose of this semidry Riesling. The medium-bodied palate echoes the nose, with a lemon-honey drizzle chiming in. It ends lifted and juicy in a zesty bite of tangerine.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Fjord 2019 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Made from grapes frozen after harvest, this sweet wine kicks off with rich aromas of apple, pear, lemon oil and marmalade. It's luscious on the palate, where gobs of honey drizzle all the fruit flavors. Pure, zesty acidity lends ample lift. It ends with a pillowy marshmallow sweetness, but pleasantly so.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2018 Estate Bottled Ice Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rounded apple and lemon flavors perfume this semidry wine. There's ample lift, thanks to bright, zesty acidity, with a delicate white tea accent lending some grip. A drizzle of honey chimes in on the finish, making this a luscious yet balanced sweeter Riesling.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Buttonwood Grove 2019 Tank Select Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of candied banana, guava and pineapple show immense lift and intensity on the nose of this late-harvest Riesling from a Cayuga Lake vineyard. It's unctuous and full on the palate, brimming with flavors of dried apricot and peach drizzled in gobs of honey. There's plenty of lift to keep this well in balance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Barnstormer 2019 Sheldrake Point Vineyard Late Harvest Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Zesty aromas of apple peel, lime zest, grapefruit and slate show nice depth and intensity on the nose of this dry Riesling. It's juicy yet crisp on the palate, with a deft feel to the bright orchard fruit flavors. It ends racy and clean on a crushed mineral tone.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wagner 2019 Dry Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Brisk aromas of lime, apple and crushed stone with a hint of butterscotch carry to the rounded palate of this neutral barrel-aged Riesling. Bright acidity lends ample lift to the coiled citrus and green apple flavors, with a quiet oak spice note riding in the background.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Buttonwood Grove 2019 Frances Amelia Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Demure aromas of yellow apple and pear blend with a slight hint of button mushroom on the nose. It's light and zesty on the dry palate, with flavors of lemonade and apple pushed along by bright acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Nathan K. 2018 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Boisterous ripe apple and peach mix with hints of ginger and white button mushroom in this semidry Riesling. It's rounded on the palate, with flavors of juiced apple and peach, and a sneak vein of bright citrus lifting it up.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Silver Thread 2019 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe apple and tangerine aromas blend with fennel and cucumber in this rounded dry Riesling. The palate is focused on lime, pineapple and crushed stone flavors, with a pithy lemon note that lingers on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Billsboro 2019 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sprightly aromas of lemon, lime and crushed salt are delicate on the nose. The medium-bodied palate echoes the nose, adding in a juicy yellow apple flavor honed by a pithy texture. It ends dry on a mouthwatering flint note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hosmer 2019 Dry Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright aromas of peach and pineapple meet tangerine on the fruity nose of this semidry Riesling. The ripe orchard and tropical fruit flavors are gently pithy on the palate, showing very good balance and length. It ends with a mouthwatering finish that leaves you coming back for more.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hunt Country Vineyards 2019 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Delicate aromas of citrus peels and white blossoms grace the nose of this medium-dry Riesling. It's bright and zesty in profile on the palate, with tart yellow apple and lemon pushed along by tangy acidity. It ends a bit short but is pleasing nonetheless.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2019 Round Rock Vineyard Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Delicate aromas of citrus peels and white blossoms grace the nose of this medium-dry Riesling. It's bright and zesty in profile on the palate, with tart yellow apple and lemon pushed along by tangy acidity. It ends a bit short but is pleasing nonetheless.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2019 Round Rock Vineyard Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Delicate aromas of peach and yellow apple meld with sunbaked slate on the nose. It's sweet on the palate yet well-balanced, displaying juicy flavors of apple, peach and white cherry, all sitting on a creamy texture. It ends on a zip of tart peach, making it a perfect aperitif.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Glenora 2019 Select Harvest Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intense aromas of pineapple, guava, lemonade and grapefruit explode from the glass. This is rich and unctuous on the sweet palate, offering luscious flavors of ripe tropical fruit and marmalade. There is nice lift from bright acidity, but it ends just a tad too sugary. Still, it's a tasty sweet Riesling that could step in as dessert.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Heron Hill 2019 Ingle Vineyard Late Harvest Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A bright, fruity nose of white peach, apple pith and lemon zest starts off this semisweet white. It's ripe and luscious on the palate, where juicy orchard fruit flavors are lifted by orange-laden acidity. While it's sweet, there's good balance to it all.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wagner 2019 Select Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Very fruity and rather full in body, this rounded and ripe wine boasts apples, peaches and hints of lemon blossoms, as well as a touch of sweetness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2019 Riesling (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sourced from Hobbit Hollow Farms near Skaneateles Lake, this wine starts off with brisk aromas of yellow apple, lemon, banana and pineapple. Semidry in style, it's juicy in ripe orchard fruit flavors on the palate, with a brisk, lightly chalky finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Buttonwood Grove 2019 Skaneateles Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Starting off with bright aromas of lime peel, kerosene and crushed stone, this light-bodied dry Riesling brings brisk flavors of citrus and apple peel on the palate. It's zesty and straightforward, racing along to a slightly savory finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bright Leaf 2019 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Delicate aromas of apple blossom and peach have a sunny, easy vibe to them on the nose. This dry Riesling is zesty yet fruity on the palate, where sweet-tart white fruit flavors end briskly on the crisp finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Buttonwood Grove 2019 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Quiet aromas of slate, lime peel and blossoms carry to the deft, light-bodied palate. This is streamlined and dry in style, with a lime and tonic vibe that makes it utterly refreshing.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Knapp 2019 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Boisterous aromas of pineapple, tangerine and yellow apple carry to the semidry palate. There's a perfumed quality to the flavors, with pithy lemon and racy acidity lending good balance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bright Leaf 2019 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Reserved on the nose, this doesn't give much away beyond lemon peels and candied blossoms. The medium-sweet palate is more giving in its flavors of juicy apple, peach and pineapple that are drizzled with a delicate string of honey. There's plenty of bright acidity for balance, but this ends a bit short. Nonetheless, it's a pleasing sweeter style Riesling that will please many.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Buttonwood Grove 2019 Big Hollow Block Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Brisk lemon, lime and thyme aromas echo on the light-bodied palate. There's some pithy grip to it all, making this a delightful semidry offering. It ends brisk and zesty, leaving you wanting another sip.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Fox Run 2019 Semi-Dry Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Rather shy aromas of lime and quince meld with an oily herb tone on the nose. There's nice weight and roundness to the feel, where bright, zesty tangerine and luscious apple tones drive the semidry palate. It cleans up nicely on the finish, where a quiet chalky note resonates.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pindar Vineyards 2019 Riesling (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The nose doesn't give much away, but the semisweet palate explodes in flavors of pear, apple and canned peach. The luscious fruit cocktail flavors is well honed by vibrant acidity, with lemon zest backing it all up. It's a well-priced offering that will please those with a sweet tooth.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2019 Circle Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe lemon and pineapple aromas show a delicate concentration on the nose. Semidry in nature, this offers tart lime and apple flavors on the palate. It ends briskly on a tangy slate note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Weis 2019 Winzer Select K Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Delicate aromas of white blossoms, citrus peels and slate carry to the light, zesty palate. This is streamlined, bright and dry in style, with pulsing lime and floral flavors that end brisk yet zesty.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2019 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of white grape and apple carry an almost candied vibe on the nose. It's rounded in feel on the palate, with juicy apple and ripe lemon flavors that are pushed along by tangerine-laden acidity. It ends dry but fruity, making this an approachable, straightforward expression.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hunt Country Vineyards 2019 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Demure aromas of lemon peel and white blossoms carry to the broad, rounded palate. Bits of warm spice chime in, but the fruit remains upfront. There's a waxy sheen to the feel, with pithy acidity lifting it all up.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Empire Estate 2018 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rather quiet aromas of white grape, pollen and lemon peel grace the nose of this semisweet Riesling. It's juicy and ripe on the palate, where luscious white peach is shot against a tart lemon backdrop. It ends short, but what's there is delicious.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Knapp 2019 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Nearly pale in color, this offers delicate aromas of lemon and apple blossom on the nose. It's light in profile on the palate, where easygoing orchard fruit flavors are shot through with zesty acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Treleaven 2019 Dry Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of sugar-dusted white blossoms and candied lemon peels carry to the light-bodied palate. Semidry in style, this is delicate in flavors of juicy apple and peach but well balanced by bright, lemony acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Swedish Hill 2019 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Very delicate aromas give off a hint of sugar-dusted white fruit on the nose. This semidry wine is light in profile, built by apple and peach flavors lifted by spritzy acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Heron Hill 2019 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's ample lift to the aromas of juiced apple, fresh ginger and tangerine on the nose of this wine. The palate is silky in feel, with pome fruit flavors that slightly lack in definition and verve. With all that, this finds cohesion and lift by the dry finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Designation: Homage Limited Production Series Tuller Vineyard
Name: Barnstormer 2019 Homage Limited Production Series Tuller Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Description: Clean and crisp aromas of chalk, nectarine and white melon show on the nose of this bottling. There is a light pear-like sweetness to the palate, which is offset by a slightly taut texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Maddalena 2019 Riesling (Monterey)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pretty aromas of yellow apple, chamomile and lemon start off this single-vineyard Riesling. It's off-dry in style, delivering easy orchard fruit flavors lifted by bright acidity. It's well-balanced yet short, ending brisk and zesty.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Swedish Hill 2019 Humphreys Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Description: Clean and crisp aromas of chalk, nectarine and white melon show on the nose of this bottling. There is a light pear-like sweetness to the palate, which is offset by a slightly taut texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Maddalena 2019 Riesling (Monterey)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Demure on the nose, this dry-style Riesling brings zesty flavors of lemon and apple alongside a sprightly note of tonic. It's all cohesive and lively, making this a delicious yet straightforward offering.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2019 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A savory, yeasty nose is almost reminiscent of raw bread dough, with apple and peach tones in the background. The palate is ripe and fruity in juiced apple and pear flavors that feel a bit thin. The acidity ultimately lends good balance but wavers on the midpalate.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Barnstormer 2019 Tuller Vineyard Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Quiet aromas of peach, apple and white blossoms carry to the semidry palate. Racy acidity lifts up the juicy fruit flavors. A lemon note verges on sour, but the fruit does well to balance it all.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Robinia Hill 2019 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A bit of yeasty funk rides over a core of citrus and apple on the nose. It's light in profile, with straightforward lemon and peach flavors lifted by bright acidity. What it lacks in concentration and length, it makes up for in a dry, zesty finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Swedish Hill 2019 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Reserved aromas of slate and lime carry the nose. This is light in feel on the palate, with deft flavors of citrus and apple. It's zesty in nature, with a savory, yeasty finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: RGNY 2018 Scielo NY Riesling (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Muddled aromas of lemon and lime mix with ripe yellow apple on the nose of this dry Riesling. It's taut in feel, a mix of orchard fruit flavors that end slightly bitter.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Heron Hill 2018 Reserve Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While the nose is pretty in aromas of apple, tangerine and crushed slate, the palate is lean and mean. Slightly sour orchard fruit flavors are driven by lasting acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hector Wine Company 2018 Dry Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This demure dry Riesling does not give much away on the nose. It's pithy and citrusy on the palate, with a short, dry finish. It can be enjoyed for its light, brisk nature and zesty drive.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Heron Hill 2019 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This demure dry Riesling doesn't give much away on the nose other than feint whiffs of thyme and citrus peels. There's a softness to the palate, where flavors of apple and lemon juice sit slightly heavy. It ends short on a yeasty note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Glenora 2019 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This semidry white is delicate in nature, offering quiet tones of peach and apple lifted by orange-laden acidity. It ends brisk but with nice zip.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Penguin Bay 2019 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This demure dry Riesling doesn't give much away on the nose other than feint whiffs of thyme and citrus peels. There's a softness to the palate, where flavors of apple and lemon juice sit slightly heavy. It ends short on a yeasty note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Glenora 2019 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While the nose is well concentrated in aromas of honey-drizzled lemon, apple and chamomile, the palate feels a bit flat. There's nice weight to it all, but it lacks drive and length.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Agness 2018 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rather closed on the nose, this wine doesn't give much away beyond a yeasty funk. The palate is nearly neutral in flavor, showing faint hints of citrus and apple. It's semidry in style, ending on a brisk lemon note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Inspire Moore 2019 Love Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
