Description: Mildly oxidized aromas of apple, peach and ginger-dusted blossoms carry the nose. The palate is spritzy and bright, with some nice textural roundness, yet it's shot through with a sour lemon flavor that doesn't relent.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Robinia Hill 2019 Reserve Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Description: From a small, cool-climate region north of Melbourne, this burnished gold-hued wine opens in aromas of lemon oil and candied ginger alongside melted butter, toffee, mushroom and mineral streaks. The palate is dry and rich but not unctuous thanks to lively acidity and a gingery bite. The finish is seemingly endless.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Jasper Hill 2018 Georgia's Paddock Riesling (Heathcote)

Description: Slicks of honey and yellow peach are dusted by slate and scorched earth in this profoundly concentrated Spätlese. It's light as a feather but packed with powerful, pulsating tangerine and orchard-fruit flavors and held upright by a zippy spine of acidity. An exhilarating, intensely fruity wine now but should continue to develop complexity for decades.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Hermann 2018 Erdener Herzlei Spätlese Alte Reben Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Intoxicating smells of petrichor, slate and smoke accent ripe honeydew and lemon. It's a smoldering yet ballerina-like Auslese that undulates with sweet honey and nectar on the palate. A stunningly balanced expression of the Mosel from an exceptionally ripe vintage. Delightful already but should reward for decades to come.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Haag 2019 Brauneberger Juffer Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Cole Ranch, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This beautifully balanced and complex wine offers tempting toasted walnut and honey aromas followed by ripe peach and orange-zest flavors backed by brilliant acidity. It has a vibrant impact on the palate and a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cole Ranch 2019 R2 Riesling (Cole Ranch)

Description: The feinherb, or off-dry designation, of this single-vineyard bottling appears only in small print on the back label here. When tasted blind, its residual sugar was almost imperceptible. What you get, rather, are ebullient, electric white peach and lemon-lime flavors colliding against a backdrop of crushed slate and earth. Medium-bodied and quite dry on the finish, it's an irresistible, thirst-quenching sip that's perfect young but likely to drink at peak through 2025 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Haag 2019 Brauneberger Juffer Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Smoke and struck flint introduce this spicy, intensely mineral dry Riesling sourced from volcanic soils. It's gorgeously steely but packed with zesty grapefruit, lime and lemon flavors as well. Slim in profile yet penetrating on the palate, it's a wine that should improve well through 2028 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schäfer-Fröhlich 2018 Vulkangestein Trocken Riesling (Nahe)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This exceptional wine is made from old vines dating back to 1972. It's bursting with zippy fruit flavors of lemon, melon, tangerine and pineapple. Though fermented dry, it has enough residual sweetness to bring hints of rock candy along for the ride. Drink now through the mid-2030s.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Trathen Hall 2018 Le Pavillon Vineyard Riesling (Dundee Hills)

Description: Sun-drenched passion fruit and mango abound from nose to finish in this gloriously tropical sip. While ballerina-like in structure, it packs a powerful punch of juicy, intensely concentrated fruit backed by a steely, spine-tingling frame of acidity. Hard to resist now for its fruity exuberance but should hold much longer.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Weller-Lehnert 2019 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: This is a tasty vintage of a classic Great Southern Riesling. Lifted, delicate aromas of fresh lemon-lime, lavender and talcum powder with a whiff of honey lead to a long, harmonious palate. A crunch of acidity makes the citrus fruit feel tingly. Ginger spice and textural layers add complexity. Bone-dry, this would make an excellent pairing with spicy Southeast Asian cuisine.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Alkoomi 2019 Riesling (Great Southern)

Description: Glorious whiffs of petrichor and pristine white peach abound on this deeply concentrated library release. Full-bodied and still fresh in demeanor, it offers a lovely combination of bright peach and lemon flavors against delicate maturity notes of earth, smoke and brine. A tug of tannins extends the finish along with a piercing strike of acidity. Lovely now but should continue to gain interesting subtleties through the decade.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2013 Forster Pechstein Library Release Dry Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Spicy notes of struck flint and slate lend earthen complexity to ripe, richly concentrated pineapple and yellow peach flavors. Light-bodied but laser-edged in focus, it's a racy, semisweet Riesling that awakens the palate and leaves a long, steely finish. Enjoyable already but should evolve beautifully for decades.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bastgen 2018 Paulinshofberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: A crush of salty, slaty minerals peppers pristine white peach and pink grapefruit flavors in this luminous medium-sweet Riesling. It's a deftly balanced sip, calibrating glorious fruit flavors against spine-tingling, steely acidity. Irresistible in youth but likely to develop well for at least a decade and hold further still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Haag 2019 Brauneberger Juffer Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Preserved yellow peach and pineapple mingle with smoke and flint in this rich, powerful off-dry Riesling. Reflective of a blockbuster vintage, it's unusually robust in extraction and density for a Kabinett but a hedonistic, profoundly tropical sip with a cheery, elegantly candied finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Bernkasteler Alte Badstube Am Doctorberg Kabinett
Name: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2019 Bernkasteler Alte Badstube Am Doctorberg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Consistency is the watchword for this single-vineyard effort. It's lushly fruity with a ripe mix of pears, tangerines and apricots. Balancing acidity doesn't push it too hard, and 16 g/L of residual sugar rounds it off without turning it sugary. It's built to age well over the next eight to 10 years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Territorial 2018 Equinox Vineyard Riesling (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Consistency is the watchword for this single-vineyard effort. It's lushly fruity with a ripe mix of pears, tangerines and apricots. Balancing acidity doesn't push it too hard, and 16 g/L of residual sugar rounds it off without turning it sugary. It's built to age well over the next eight to 10 years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Territorial 2018 Equinox Vineyard Riesling (Willamette Valley)

Description: Just one whiff of this smoky, salty Kabinett places you in the Saar. Exceptionally light on its feet and pulsating with flavors of zippy lime, grapefruit and green apple, it's a slim yet penetrating little Riesling that's particularly delicious young but concentrated enough to hold for years to come.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Willems-Willems 2018 Saar Kabinett Oberemmel Altenberg Riesling (Mosel)

Description: It's still rare in the U.S. for consumers to have access to dry, well-aged Riesling, and the library-release bottlings from Villa Wolf are both well-priced and high in quality. This full-bodied, deeply concentrated example is showing its secondary characteristics beautifully now. Smoky and intensely earthen yet still fresh in lemon and lime, it's a stately, textural wine that should continue to develop well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2013 Wachenheimer Belz Library Release Dry Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Tangerine and lemon are honeyed and plump on the palate of this rich white. It's a juicy, decadently fruity sip marked by sun-kissed sweetness and fresh, vital acidity. While particularly enjoyable young, it should hold well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2019 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Subtle aromas of honeydew and lime gain a tropical flair on the palate of this juicy, profoundly fruity sweet Riesling. Light-bodied but richly extracted in guava, mango and tangerine flavors, it's a juicy wine that's delightful young but structured enough to develop complexity for another decade at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2019 Bernkasteler Badstube Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Hibiscus nectar and lime blossoms perfume this beautifully pure-fruited, feather-light Kabinett. It's delectably off-dry, balancing pert lemon acidity against pristine honeydew and white peach flavors. Piercing and steely on the finish, it's at peak now–2025 but will hold much longer.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maximin Grünhäuser 2019 Herrenberg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Crisp pineapple, lime and lemon extend from nose to finish in this light-footed, laser-edged Riesling. Dry in style yet invigorating and zippy, it's a refreshing contrast to increasingly voluptuous styles of dry German Riesling in riper vintages. Steely and long on the finish, it should continue to develop nicely through 2028.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ökonomierat Rebholz 2018 Birkweiler Vom Rotliegenden Trocken Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Ripe honeydew and white peach flavors penetrate this rich, intensely concentrated Spätlese. It's sumptuously sweet and weighty on the palate yet balanced by zippy lime acidity and a lingering spray of crushed stones. Just reaching peak now, it should drink well for a decade to come.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Zeltinger Sonnenuhr Spätlese Josefberg Old Vines
Name: Weingut Albert Gessinger 2018 Zeltinger Sonnenuhr Spätlese Josefberg Old Vines Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Spicy notes of sunbaked clay and slate penetrate through sunny yellow peach and tangerine in this nuanced dry white. Equal parts fruit and earth bolstered against spine-tingling lime acidity, it's a complex but thirst-quenching wine that should drink at peak through 2025 but hold longer as well.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Haag 2019 Brauneberger Trocken J Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Dry in style yet exuberantly fruity, this medium-bodied Riesling is packed to the rims with juicy Asian pear, tangerine and white peach flavors. It's a lavishly ripe, plumply textured sip balanced by zingy lemon-lime acidity and a cooling mineral finish. Best now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Bernkasteler Alte Badstube Am Doctorberg Dry
Name: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2019 Bernkasteler Alte Badstube Am Doctorberg Dry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Luscious in texture and voluminous on the palate, this profoundly ripe off-dry Riesling offers juicy lemon and lime flavors edged by plumes of green floral perfume. It's a rich expression of Kabinett, but a zippy spine of acidity lends balance and leads a long, stony finish. At peak now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2019 Graacher Himmelreich Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Lime zest and graphite introduce this piercing, strikingly mineral dry Riesling. Piercing acidity and tangs of slate and steel on the palate lend a firm, upright tone. An elegant, rather cerebral wine that should meld beautifully now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schäfer-Fröhlich 2018 Trocken Riesling (Nahe)

Description: Struck slate and petrichor introduce this unmistakably Mosel Riesling. Pineapple and white peach flavors are profoundly ripe, sweetening the palate with streaks of honey and nectar, but it's a balanced, reverberating sip that finishes on staccato notes of acidity and steel. At peak now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Mönchhof 2018 Slate Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: A touch of pollen lends complexity to pure, pristine lime, guava and grapefruit in this jubilant, fruit-focused Riesling. Medium-sweet and spry on the palate, it's a juicy, deeply concentrated wine that should drink at peak through 2030 and hold further still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Peter Nicolay 2019 Bernkastel Badstube Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Cole Ranch, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Vibrant but smooth, this elegant fruit-centered wine surrounds ample green-apple and white-peach flavors with a rich, polished texture that also shows appetizing acidity. Subtle aromas of almond and ham give way to complex fruit flavors on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cole Ranch 2019 Cole Ranch Vineyard Riesling (Cole Ranch)

Description: Whiffs of plump white peach and pineapple on the nose contrast the steely intensity of this totally dry, profoundly mineral Riesling. Focused and gorgeously angular in style, it's a refreshingly svelte but concentrated expression of an intensely ripe vintage. A bit nervous in youth but should meld gorgeously through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Haag 2019 Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Exuberantly tropical notes of mango and papaya are offset by spice and crushed earth in this intensely fruity, exhilarating Riesling. It's just a shade off-dry with just enough sweetness to balance out racy acidity. A highly quaffable, invigorating sip that's at peak now–2025 but should hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2019 Single Vineyard Wehlener Klosterberg Offdry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Passion fruit and guava flavors are slicked with honey and lime in this penetrating off-dry Riesling. It's a powerfully fruity sip countered by a bold spine of acidity. A bit nervous in youth, it should meld and improve over the next few years.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2019 Wehlener Sonnenuhr  Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Exuberantly tropical notes of mango and papaya are offset by spice and crushed earth in this intensely fruity, exhilarating Riesling. It's just a shade off-dry with just enough sweetness to balance out racy acidity. A highly quaffable, invigorating sip that's at peak now–2025 but should hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2019 Single Vineyard Wehlener Klosterberg Offdry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Passion fruit and guava flavors are slicked with honey and lime in this penetrating off-dry Riesling. It's a powerfully fruity sip countered by a bold spine of acidity. A bit nervous in youth, it should meld and improve over the next few years.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2019 Wehlener Sonnenuhr  Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Pert, cutting notes of lime zest and green apple are dusted with salt and slate in this bracing, classically Mosel Riesling. An electric shade of off-dry, it's a zappy lemon-lime sip marked by piercing acidity and a lingering, delicate sweetness. Delicious now but should drink well through 2025, at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ulrich Langguth 2019 Piesporter Günterslay Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Sunbaked slate and dusty earth tones introduce this spry, spice-tinged Riesling. Dry and focused yet not at all stern in style, it offsets its mineral intensity with pristine lemon and white peach flavors. A thirst-quenching, elegant wine that's best now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Loosen 2019 Red Slate Dry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Juicy pineapple and crystalline mineral tones abound in this profoundly ripe but briskly balanced Kabinett. Off-dry and delightfully salty on the finish, it's an easy-drinking yet elegant, linear sip anchored by a backbone of steel. Ready now but should drink at peak through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2019 Bernkasteler Badstube Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: There's barely any perceptible residual sugar on the palate of this crisp, profoundly mineral Riesling. A well-priced bottling sourced entirely from the estate's monopole single vineyard, it offers crisp, cutting notes of honeydew and greengage plums dusted with slate and crushed earth. A uniquely zippy expression of a profoundly ripe vintage, it's drinking beautifully young but should hold well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maximin Grünhäuser 2019 Monopol Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Pert, cutting notes of lime zest and green apple are dusted with salt and slate in this bracing, classically Mosel Riesling. An electric shade of off-dry, it's a zappy lemon-lime sip marked by piercing acidity and a lingering, delicate sweetness. Delicious now but should drink well through 2025, at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ulrich Langguth 2019 Piesporter Günterslay Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Shades of slate and sunbaked earth permeate into pink grapefruit and guava in this piercing ballerina-like Kabinett. Laced with sweet nectar and backed by a firm undertone of acidity and steel, it's a laser-edged white that finishes on a long, intensely mineral crush. Irresistible in youth but concentrated enough to drink well through 2025, at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bollig-Lehnert 2019 Trittenheimer Apotheke Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Fully dry yet slim in profile, this sleek, penetrating Riesling offers elegance beyond its easy price point. Kissed by sprays of white blossom and piercing grapefruit flavor, it's a thirst-quenching, zesty white best enjoyed now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Robert Weil 2019 Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Aromas of tart greengage plum and lime blossoms meld into grapefruit and lemon on the palate of this dry, medium-bodied white. Deeply extracted and fringed by a whisper of tea tannin, it's a solidly structured Riesling that could accompany even heartier dishes like pork or beef with ease. Ready now but should drink well through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Von Buhl 2018 Bone Dry Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Whiffs of lime zest and crushed stone mingle with crisp pineapple and grapefruit in this silky, textured dry Riesling. It's zippy and spry but delightfully mouthfilling, too, finishing long on tart white melon and lemongrass notes. An easy-drinking but elegant white that appeals broadly, it should be at peak now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Pfeffingen 2019 Dry Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Delicate but perfumed, this deft, sprightly Riesling offers rich, concentrated pink grapefruit and white peach flavors etched by lime and steel. It's a juicy, thirst-quenching wine that's gobs of fun to drink young but should continue to drink beautifully through 2029.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bollig-Lehnert 2019 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Delicate but perfumed, this deft, sprightly Riesling offers rich, concentrated pink grapefruit and white peach flavors etched by lime and steel. It's a juicy, thirst-quenching wine that's gobs of fun to drink young but should continue to drink beautifully through 2029.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bollig-Lehnert 2019 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Fully dry yet slim in profile, this sleek, penetrating Riesling offers elegance beyond its easy price point. Kissed by sprays of white blossom and piercing grapefruit flavor, it's a thirst-quenching, zesty white best enjoyed now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Robert Weil 2019 Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Dry in style and light as a feather, this perfumed Riesling wafts of orange blossoms and lime zest. Racy acidity is offset by mouthwatering grapefruit and white peach flavors on the palate. A fantastic entry-level offering from a consistently outstanding producer that's at peak now–2023 but likely to hold further still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wittmann 2019 Estate Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: This is a delightfully spine-tingling off-dry Riesling that jolts the senses awake with piercing flavors of honeydew nectar, lime and crushed slate. It's exuberant and juicy but complex and intensely mineral, too, finishing long on a Margarita-like kiss of salt and lime sorbet. Gorgeous in youth but concentrated enough to drink at peak through 2025 and hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Peter Nicolay 2019 Bernkastel Badstube Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Hints of yellow peach and cut stone are delicate on the nose but amass power and concentration on the palate. Sumptuously off-dry, it's a honeyed, nectar-like sip that's packed with juicy nectarine and tangerine flavors framed by a zesty spine of acidity. Penetrating through a long finish, it should drink at peak through 2025 and hold further still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2019 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Lime zest and green apples perfume this zesty, green-fruited sip. Properly feinherb in style, there's just a whisper of sweetness glazing the palate like lace against a backdrop of pristine, spine-tingling gooseberry and grapefruit flavor. An energizing wine that's delicious now but should hold well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Leimbrock 2018 Graacher Himmelreich Spätlese Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Staccato notes of caramelized honey and lime zest abound in this spine-tingling white. Just a hint off-dry in style, it's a zippy, electric shock of steel and acidity softened by flavors of pristine lemon, white grapefruit and green apple. A lovely sip to enjoy young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2019 Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Fully dry but loaded with juicy mango and guava flavors, this is an easy-drinking white likely to please broadly. Medium in weight and plump yet vibrant and zesty, it's particularly delightful young, but should hold through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2019 Dry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Just a whisper of sweetness accents plump white grapefruit and lime flavors in this almost-dry, lusciously textured Riesling. A blossomy, perfumed white held upright by brisk acidity and a long, stony finish, it's at peak now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Zilliken 2019 Butterfly Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Fritz Haag's value entry-level Riesling shares the same smoky, seductive spice and earth tones of the producer's more expensive single-vineyard bottlings, but with an immediately approachable fruitiness and zeal. Just a shade off-dry, it's packed with thirst-quenching white grapefruit and peachy goodness anchored by a firm, mineral undertone. Best now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Haag 2019 Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Pristine, fragrant white peach and chalky mineral tones collide in this dry, fresh-fruited Riesling. Steely on the finish, it's a remarkable value for a sophisticated yet easy-drinking wine that's likely to please many. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Loosen 2019 Dr. L Dry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Crisp green apples and white blossoms perfume this luminously fresh, mouthwatering white sourced from a handful of vineyards in the Mosel-Ruwer region outside of the estate's monopole. An ideal introduction to the zippy Maximin Grünhaus style, it's a crowd-pleasing, lemon-lime sip that finishes with just a trace of balancing sweetness on the finish. Best now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maximin Grünhäuser 2019 Maximin Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Pristine, fragrant white peach and chalky mineral tones collide in this dry, fresh-fruited Riesling. Steely on the finish, it's a remarkable value for a sophisticated yet easy-drinking wine that's likely to please many. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Loosen 2019 Dr. L Dry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Struck flint and honeydew introduce this lip-smacking, fruity off-dry Riesling. It's a juicy, thirst-quenching wine marked by pristine white grapefruit and yellow plum flavors but grounded by a firm undertone of minerality. Approachable yet refined, it should drink well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Hermann 2019 Dr. H Riesling (Mosel)

Description: This historic estate is famed for extremely old fortified wines, but its newly released table wine range provides solid modern Barossa tipples at affordable prices. The Riesling is bright and spritzy, jumping from the glass with lemon-lime sherbet aromas and softer honey and flower blossom characters. The palate is both slippery and chalky as well as clean and fruity but still bouncy and bright. A straightforward, likable drop.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Seppeltsfield 2019 Riesling (Eden Valley)

Description: In true feinherb style, there's barely any perceptible residual sugar in this zingy lightsaber of a Riesling. Zippy streaks of lime, lemon and grapefruit invigorate the senses and leave a long, steely finish. Quite delightful young but should hold through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Huesgen 2019 Kabinett Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Delicate hints of steel and slate mingle with white blossom and peach on the nose of this seductive off-dry Riesling. Spine-tingling and pristinely fruity, it's packed with sunny tangerine and grapefruit flavors etched by crystalline minerality. A thirst-quenching wine best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2019 Offdry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Sourced from the famed Würzgarten, or spice garden, there's an spicy, smoky sheen that lends an earthen backdrop to this lip-smacking sip. Kissed by honeysuckle nectar, it's delectably off-dry but racy, with acidity, too. The finish is long and marked by piercing yellow peach and apricot flavors. At peak now–2025 but should hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Hermann 2019 Ürziger Würzgarten Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Layers of smoky, dusty mineral and earth lend savory complexities to dazzling yellow cherry, peach and tangerine flavors in this ripe but zippy white. Approachably fruity yet focused and pure, it's held upright by streaks of lime acidity and a firm, steely finish. Delicious young but should hold through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Weingut Karp-Schreiber 2019 My Karp Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Spicy, dusty mineral notes introduce this very spry, lemon-lime sip. Dry and slim in profile, it's a refreshingly zippy expression of Riesling from a ripe, rather voluptuous vintage. Drinks well now but should hold well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wittmann 2019 100 Hills Dry Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: Bold, sun-kissed aromas of yellow peach and pineapple drive the palate of this medium-dry Riesling. It's a light-bodied and zesty but intensely fruity sip packed with pristine tangerine and lime flavors. The finish is racy and edged by a lingering stony minerality.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Raimund Prüm 2019 Essence Riesling (Mosel)

Description: This is such a juicy, intensely fruity wine packed with mouthwatering honeydew and mango flavors. Off-dry and a bit honeyed in style, it's a light-bodied but luscious sip that drinks delightfully young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Heinz Eifel 2019 Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Cooling tones of fresh mint and green melon rind introduce this slim, pure-fruited dry Riesling. Exceptionally light on its feet and racy in style, it's a lime-inflected white that's ideal as an accompaniment to anything from sushi to roast chicken. Best now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Huesgen 2019 By The Glass Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Bright yellow peach and nectarine flavors are edged by chalky, dusty mineral tones in this fresh-fruited yet deeply earthen wine. Dry and full-bodied yet steely and focused, it finishes on a fringe of spice. Best now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Weingut Georg Albrecht Schneider 2018 Vom Kalk Niersteiner Trocken-Dry Kabinett Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: This is a joyously juicy, fruity off-dry Riesling packed with sun-drenched yellow cherry and peach flavors. Fresh with lemon-lime acidity and feather-light on its feet, it's an easy-drinking, revitalizing sip that rewards youthful drinking.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Loosen 2019 Dr. L Riesling (Mosel)

Description: This is an intensely juicy medium-dry Riesling bursting with sun-drenched honeydew, white peach and guava flavors. Light on its feet but richly concentrated in fruit, it's a lip-smacking, zesty white that's particularly appealing young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2019 Blitz Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Brisk tangs of lime and pineapple lend zest to this light-footed dry Riesling. Intently mineral on the palate, it's a subtle yet thirst-quenching white that's ideal as an aperitif or party wine. Best now–2022. This cuvée is also labeled under the Hooked brand.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Gryphon Crest 2017 Dry Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: Crisp green apple and grapefruit on the nose turn riper on the palate of this light-bodied but richly concentrated white. Off-dry and plush in fruit, it's balanced neatly by zippy lime acidity. The finish is long and marked by a hint of dry earth. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Hansen-Lauer 2018 Bernkasteler Badstube Riesling (Mosel)

Description: In line with an exceptionally ripe vintage, the 2019 Noble House is an exuberantly tropical, fruit-forward sip packed with luscious mango, tangerine and guava flavors. Juicy and concentrated, it's a straightforward but hedonistic crowd-pleaser that begs to be enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2019 Noble House Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Smoky spice and bright tropical fruit introduce this succulent yet spine-tingling dry white. It's a briskly concentrated, racy sip with a lingering tangerine finish. Best enjoyed now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Peter Nicolay 2019 Ürziger Würzgarten Dry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Notes of pine frond and mint lend a cooling, vital freshness to this feather-light Riesling. Off dry in style, it's a pristine, lemony sip that finishes long on a delicately earthen tone. Best now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: St. Urbans-Hof 2019 Nik Weis Urban Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Just a whisper off-dry and zippy on the palate, Gourmet is an apt name for this style of zesty, food-friendly Riesling. Quaffable and spry, it offers crisp flavors of green apple and honeydew lifted by zesty lime acidity on the midpalate. At peak now but should hold well through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ulrich Langguth 2019 Gourmet Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Notes of lemon, lime and gooseberry lend bristling freshness to this dry, medium-bodied Riesling. Steely and bracing on the palate, it's a savory, slightly smoky sip that's marked by a fringe of bitters on the finish. Ready now but should drink well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ökonomierat Rebholz 2018 Trocken Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Gentle aromas of citrus zest, flint and a slight nuttiness open on this straightforward Riesling. The palate is creamy with enough acidity to keep it refreshing. Citrus, nut and a slight caramel flavor carry through to the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Château Tanunda 2019 Grand Barossa Dry Riesling (Barossa)

Description: Whiffs of pineapple and white peach gain power and concentration on the palate of this very juicy, fruity sip. It's a plump, elegantly sweet Riesling balanced by a fresh mineral tone and piercing lemon-lime acidity. An approachable, refreshing style of Auslese at peak now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Heinz Eifel 2019 Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: This is a pert, easy-drinking Riesling packed with pristine yellow cherry and white peach flavors. It's a fresh, fruity sip framed by spine-tingling acidity and an elegant rim of bitters on the finish. Best now–2023. This cuvée is also labeled under the Gryphon Crest brand.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Hooked 2018 Riesling (Mosel)

Description: This is a pert, easy-drinking Riesling packed with pristine yellow cherry and white peach flavors. It's a fresh, fruity sip framed by spine-tingling acidity and an elegant rim of bitters on the finish. Best now–2023. This cuvée is also labeled under the Hooked brand.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Gryphon Crest 2018 Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Brisk tangs of lime and pineapple lend zest to this light-footed dry Riesling. Intently mineral on the palate, it's a subtle yet thirst-quenching white that's ideal as an aperitif or party wine. Best now–2022. This cuvée is also labeled under the Gryphon Crest brand.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Hooked 2017 Dry Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: This is a profoundly fruity, forward sip packed with tropical melon, orange and mango flavors. Subtle undertones of earth and pollen along with sunny lemon acidity lend balance throughout. Best enjoyed now–2022 to enjoy its youthful exuberance.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2019 Piesporter Michelsberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: The nose is subtle and earthy, a contrast to ripe, sunny tangerine and pineapple flavors in this light-footed off-dry white. Piercing lime acidity and steely notes on the midpalate accentuate it's zesty, invigorating feel. Best enjoyed now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2019 Erdener Treppchen Offdry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Crisp honeydew and lime notes are etched by hints of bee pollen and caramelized sugar in this delicately sweet Riesling. It's a juicy, thirst-quenching sip with bright acidity and a pleasant murmur of bitters on the finish. Drink now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Weingut Albert Gessinger 2018 Zeltinger Schlossberg Kabinett Alte Reben Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Subtle notes of green melon rind and gooseberry on the nose gain a honeyed sweetness on the palate of this fresh, easy-drinking Riesling. Off-dry in style and balanced by cutting lime acidity, it's a refreshing sip best enjoyed now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Kreuznacher 2019 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Yellow peach and nectarine flavors are lip-smacking and zesty in this bright-fruited but dry white. At peak now–2023, it's an easy-drinking, briskly balanced Riesling that's likely to please a diverse crowd.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Peter Nicolay 2019 Dry Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This sweet wine overflows with ripe peach flavors and has a characteristic light smoke and meat aroma. It's mouthcoating and medium bodie and similar in sweetness to a German Auslese.                      Jim Gordon
Name: V. Sattui 2019 Riesling (Anderson Valley)

Description: Hints of pollen and dusty minerals lend an earthen undertone to unctuous pineapple and yellow peach flavors. Medium-sweet and zippy on the palate, it balances rich, slightly caramelized fruit tones against spine-tingling lime acidity. Best enjoyed now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Windisch 2018 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: While the nose is quiet, there's loads of easy, juicy white peach and grapefruit flavors in this straightforward medium-sweet Riesling. Sunny tangerine acidity and just a whiff of freshly laundered linen linger on the finish. Drink now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schmitt Söhne 2019 Relax Riesling (Germany)

Description: While light in body, there's a slightly treacly nature to candied lemon and tangerine flavors. Medium sweet in style but balanced by fresh acidity, it's a straightforward, juicy sip best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2019 Riesling (Mosel)

Description: The nose is subtly earthen, but the palate offers soft, juicy flavors of preserved yellow peach and tangerine. It's a loosely knit, semi-dry Riesling that's brightened by sunny lemon acidity. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Twisted River 2019 Bin 168 Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Crushed lemon leaf and a heady hint of conifer peek through on the shy but nonetheless rather citric nose. The palate with its cut and concentration leaves you in no doubt about its absolute steeliness, its inherent drive, its uncompromising but ripe freshness. That lovely conifer and lemon notion still plays aromatically around the edges, making this heady and lifted. A profound core of stone lends eternal energy. Drink 2025–2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Alzinger 2019 Ried Loibenberg Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

Description: Notes of crushed citrus leaf are tender on the wine's nose, but also lifted. Their etheral nature has a sharpening, invigorating effect. These heady, sharp citrus notes are even more precise and pervasive on the palate, shimmering in tones of lime zest, candied lemon, yuzu leaf and tangerine. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bründlmayer 2019 Ried Heiligenstein Alte Reben Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: Faint notes of ripe Mirabelle come with a notions of crushed lemon leaf while a certain citrus headiness makes its way to the pleasure center of the brain. The palate is bundled and compact, offering continuous bursts of citrus freshness. The effect is both exciting and cooling, invigorating and calming. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bründlmayer 2019 Ried Heiligenstein Lyra Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: This wine's nose wants to give little away apart from a little tease of crushed yuzu leaf. The palate is similarly taut and still tightly coiled, holding all of its citrus secrets tight. It is the mouthwatering concentration and the pulsating citus energy that emanates from a deeply stony core that gives the game away. This is chiseled and precise but uncompromisingly fresh and mouthwatering. Drink 2030–2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Alzinger 2019 Ried Steinertal Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

Description: A gentle hint of ripe tangerine peel immediately hits the nose. With more air, this unfolds to include notions of ripe blood orange and Mandarin, too. The palate comes in with steely concentration that speaks as much of absolute freshness as of glorious ripeness. The flavors are pristine, contoured by immense raciness. There is something steely and stony at the very core that radiates utter freshness. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domäne Wachau 2019 Ried Achleiten Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

Description: A subtle notion of ripe Amalfi lemon zest hovers on the wine's nose. The palate then comes in and sweeps up this lemony notion in riper aspects of Mandarin and Tarocco orange. The zesty allure is both fresh and pervasive, and comes with a lovely, pithy texture. This is a marvel of purity, ripeness, expression and toned power. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Eichinger 2019 Ried Heiligenstein Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: A subtle notion of ripe Amalfi lemon zest hovers on the wine's nose. The palate then comes in and sweeps up this lemony notion in riper aspects of Mandarin and Tarocco orange. The zesty allure is both fresh and pervasive, and comes with a lovely, pithy texture. This is a marvel of purity, ripeness, expression and toned power. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Eichinger 2019 Ried Heiligenstein Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: The lemon note on the nose is tender yet focused and pure. The concentrated palate comes off as crystalline in nature, almost fragile. The mentholated freshness lingers on the palate. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wohlmuth 2019 Ried Dr. Wunsch Riesling (Südsteiermark)

Description: A gorgeous greenish whiff of crushed citrus leaf is the first notion to rise from the glass, followed by zesty ripe lemon. The palate continues with that same bright and mouthwatering zestiness. There is something streamlined here, something eternally cooling, fresh and refreshing. Immense concentration makes that lemony core shine with intensity and utter brightness. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Georg Frischengruber 2019 Ried Goldberg Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

Description: A ripe notion of Mandarin peel is framed entirely by lemony brightness but shining through nonetheless. On the palate, the opposite is true. A ripe Mandarin tone is full of sun-ripened charm while lemon is at the zesty core. That aromatic citrus nature is utterly mouthwatering, energeting, streamlined and joyous. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2019 1000-Eimerberg Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

Description: A strong notion of blood orange peel and tangerine rises beguilingly from the glass, spelling ripeness and tanginess in equal measure. The concentrated palate follows suit and presents a core of stone and citrus, sleek, stelly, bold but also fine-boned. Despite this essentially austere core this drips with juiciness and aroma. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Josef Hirsch 2019 Ried Heiligenstein Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: Aromas of smoke and freshly dried hay are wrapped in recurring waves of citrus. There is ripe Amlafi lemon but also tangy, spicy tangerine peel. The palate also mixes a funky yeastiness into this almost delirious sense of citrus zest. The result is a delicious tussle between eathiness and soaring structure. Irresistible now but certain to evolve. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jurtschitsch 2019 Ried Heiligenstein Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: Aromas of smoke and freshly dried hay are wrapped in recurring waves of citrus. There is ripe Amlafi lemon but also tangy, spicy tangerine peel. The palate also mixes a funky yeastiness into this almost delirious sense of citrus zest. The result is a delicious tussle between eathiness and soaring structure. Irresistible now but certain to evolve. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jurtschitsch 2019 Ried Heiligenstein Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: A still shy nose is not ready to give up its secrets easily, despite much swirling and air. It is the palate that lifts the veil on the citric depth and intensity at the heart of this wine. Tangerine and lemon seem to emanate from a deep, stony, steely and cool depth. That citrus heart is concentrated and seems to draw on a boundless energy that drives it forward with purpose. This is beautiful, chiseled and unbelievably vivid. Drink 2025–2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Pichler-Krutzler 2019 Ried Kellerberg Riesling (Wachau)

Description: A touch of dried apple peel appears before the candied lemon notes take over on the nose. The palate then presents profound stoniness on a body that combines lightness and depth in a way that only Riesling can. This is only just beginning to show its true face, helped along by that pristine sense of lemon and tanginess. This is fresh, pervasive, slender, elegant and utterly life-affirming.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Weszeli 2016 Ried Heiligenstein Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: Tangerine, Mandarin and ripe Navel orange notions fill the nose with their citric headiness. The palate adds a pithy and earthy vein to give contour and grip. This is concentrated, textured, energetic, streamlined and alive. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Sepp Moser 2019 Ried Gebling Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: A flinty, smoky whiff still speaks of a little yeasty reduction, but deliciously so. A zesty, mouthwatering streak of lemon shines through, creating a tingling sense of freshness. All this is contained in a stony, taut, sleek body. Hold on to your seats, this is freshness supercharged. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Steininger 2019 Ried Steinhaus Reserve Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: Ripe red apple, dried orange peel and sundried hay come together and make for a most resonant, appetizing nose. The palate has a gorgeously creamy, smooth texture, like melting, ripe red-apple flesh, that is outlined by the soaring purity of citrus oil. What a wonderfully concentrated, textured and individual wine. What effortless balance, what smooth, balm-like yet fresh joy. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Loimer 2018 Ried Seeberg Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: An initially tangy notion of grapefruit zest and crushed citrus leaf turns into a ripe Mandarin tone on the aromatic nose. That grapefruit zestiness is never far and seems to give an extra aromatic edge and even more liveliness to the already racy citrus nature of this wine. This is joyous, bold, concentrated, streamlined and unbelievably delicious. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2019 Ried Kalkofen Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

Description: Golden Mirabelle fruit is framed with the lifted, almost ethereal freshness of crushed lemon leaf. More air then adds a reassuring whiff of yeasty funk that carries right onto the taut, toned palate where it provides lovely texture and a counterpoint to all of this fruit-filled freshness. This is a class act, concentrated, resonant, bold but elegant in its bullet-like delivery. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jäger 2019 Ried Achleiten Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

Description: Ripe red apple, dried orange peel and sundried hay come together and make for a most resonant, appetizing nose. The palate has a gorgeously creamy, smooth texture, like melting, ripe red-apple flesh, that is outlined by the soaring purity of citrus oil. What a wonderfully concentrated, textured and individual wine. What effortless balance, what smooth, balm-like yet fresh joy. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Loimer 2018 Ried Seeberg Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: Candied lime zest and lemon on the nose have the merest touch of juniper. There is flow, concentration and a zestiness on the palate that seems to stem from the flavor of sun-ripened, tangy lemons. This aromatic freshness fills mouth and mind with its luminosity. This is gorgeous, pure and precise. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Georg Frischengruber 2019 Ried Kirnberg Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

Description: The perfume of tangerine, lemon and blood orange zest on the nose is startlingly aromatic even though it is still tinged with some yeasty funk. That vivid display of citrus richness contrasts with the stony concentration of the steely palate. This is taut and tight, streamlined and vivid, yet dripping with ripe, mellow juiciness. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Josef Hirsch 2019 Ried Gaisberg Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: Rich notes of dried hay are made ethereal by the pervasive, lifted and almost menthol-like intensity of dried lemon peel. An earthy pithiness swings alongside, almost acting as a ballast to these sky-bound aromas. The palate adds juicy, rounded Mirabelle which is depicted in the glaring, pristine presence of brightest lemon freshness. This is gorgeous and gives you a mere glimpse of what Riesling can do once it matures. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Weszeli 2016 Ried Steinmassl Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: The ethereal lift of crushed citrus foliage just about escapes the shy nose, sending an advance signal of fragrance and freshness. More air adds an equally fragrant note of conifer while citrus kicks high on on the pristine, stony palate. This is taut and fresh but it harbors riper tones of Mandarin and Mirabelle at its heart. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wohlmuth 2018 Ried Edelschuh Riesling (Südsteiermark)

Description: A creamy sense of wet hazelnut blends with a lemon note on the aromatic nose. The palate also displays this rich, creamy, smooth nut tone alongside a beautifully ripe streak of lemon acidity. This is a wonderful counterplay of oak and soaring Riesling freshness. It is already lovely but will knit together beautifully over the coming years. Drink 2023–2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Malat 2019 Ried Steinbühel Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: Only the faintest hint of citrus zest can be made out on the nose. The palate then arrives on tiptoe, leaving a tingling trace of sizzling zestiness with every little imprint. Bit by bit, the zestiness reaches critical volume and crashes into a wave of flavor. It is the lightness that gets you and that keeps on vibrating through the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wohlmuth 2018 Phyllit Strohbart Riesling (Südsteiermark)

Description: Just a faint note of candied kumquat appears on the shy nose. The palate then brings in crystallised Mandarin, walking that tightrope between sweet abandon and tingling acidity. It does so in a dancing, slender and agile fashion. This offers a superb highwire act that makes a virtue of the very weightlessness of the wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wohlmuth 2019 Phyllit Dr. Wu Spätlese Riesling (Südsteiermark)

Description: A hint of passion fruit adds a tropical overtone to the incredibly fresh lemon and tangerine notes on the nose. The palate plays a similar game as it overlays that essential, concentrated citrus zestiness with warmer, more tropical accents. In essense, however, the wine remains citric, pristine, streamlined and driven.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2019 Ried Kögl Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: The aromatic notions on the nose are subdued but give delicious momentary glimpses of red apple peel and dried blood orange zest. The palate then sets its sights entirely on the wonderful citrus zestiness that seems to sizzle along. The body is sinuous, clear, concentrated and driven, making this a bundle of aromatic energy.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2019 Ried Pfaffenberg Alte Reben Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: A hint of passion fruit adds a tropical overtone to the incredibly fresh lemon and tangerine notes on the nose. The palate plays a similar game as it overlays that essential, concentrated citrus zestiness with warmer, more tropical accents. In essense, however, the wine remains citric, pristine, streamlined and driven.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2019 Ried Kögl Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: The aromatic notions on the nose are subdued but give delicious momentary glimpses of red apple peel and dried blood orange zest. The palate then sets its sights entirely on the wonderful citrus zestiness that seems to sizzle along. The body is sinuous, clear, concentrated and driven, making this a bundle of aromatic energy.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2019 Ried Pfaffenberg Alte Reben Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: Dried lemon peel, a touch of fir honey and chamomile are concentrated on the nose. The palate right away sets a countertone to this aromatic richness with vivid, still slightly fizzy lemon freshness that reverberates throughout the slender, concentrated body. This is vivid, smooth, earthy and round, but also direct and wonderfully insistent.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Diwald 2018 Ried Eisenhut Riesling (Wagram)

Description: A tropical hint of pineapple is almost immediately usurped by tangerine peel on the nose. More ethereal notions of crushed citrus leaf also come in. The palate has a riper feel of rounded stone fruit edged with pepper and even more tangerine zestiness. This is bold, bright and concentrated. Gorgeous now, it is certain to shine even brighter with bottle age. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Nigl 2019 Ried Hochäcker Privat Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: A gentle notion of Mandarin peel is all the shy nose reveals, even with lots of swirling. The palate intensifies that Mandarin note and also adds a yeasty, earthy touch but he body is essentially stony, taut, concentrated and sleek. This is beautifully honed and while powerful also incredibly poised. Drink 2025–2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hiedler 2019 Ried Heiligenstein Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: Hayflowers and ripe Navel oranges are evoked on the vivid nose. The concentrated palate adds an earthy tone but overall it soars with citrus freshness. Yes, this is ripe but it is also alive with juicy fruit, edged with pithy firmness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Stift Göttweig 2019 Ried Pfaffenberg Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: Fresh tangerine and Mandarin notes dance on the nose and continue right onto the palate. Here, they are joined by a bright, vivid streak of lemon freshness that makes the senses tingle and the mouth water. This is streamlined but luminous, straight-laced but frivolous and wonderfully profound. The tangerine length on the finish is astonishing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Malat 2019 Ried Silberbichl Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: The nose is subdued but shows a tender note of candied lemon peel and something akin to summer blossoms. The palate has nothing tentative about it, on the contrary, it simply shines with a bright ripe lemon note. This is luminous and fresh but also stony and cool. There is an inherent elegance and slenderness despite that concentrated flavor.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Markus Huber 2019 Ried Berg Riesling (Traisental)

Description: Vivid, zesty notes of tangerine are immediately present on the scented, fresh nose. The palate also has an almost fizzing, zesty tanginess that heightens that sense of mouthwatering juiciness. The body is taut, fresh, ripe, bright and like a bundle of streamlined energy. Yes, this is fun and fresh, but it sure has the mileage to go on and on. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Allram 2019 Ried Gaisberg Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: A stony smokiness hovers above the nose, only slowly giving way to pear and lemon. The palate then bursts into fruit with notions of ripe apple and Mirabelle framed and contoured by lemon brightness. It is that citrus freshness that soars towards the finish, mouthwatering, insistent and sustained.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bründlmayer 2019 Ried Steinmassl Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: The notes of crushed yuzu leaf on the nose have a lifted intensity. The palate is the counterpart to these soaring aromatics with its lovely, concentrated depth. It shows an enduring lemon note alongside ripe Mirabelle plum. This has an enlivening, vivid energy that will evolve well.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2019 Alte Reben Riesling (Niederösterreich)

Description: A shy nose had a hint of hayflowers and lemon zest. The concentrated yet tight palate sweeps in with lemony force. There is cool concentration, vivid freshness and real drive in this supremely toned wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hiedler 2019 Ried Gaisberg Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: A shy nose had a hint of hayflowers and lemon zest. The concentrated yet tight palate sweeps in with lemony force. There is cool concentration, vivid freshness and real drive in this supremely toned wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hiedler 2019 Ried Gaisberg Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: A hint of grapefruit zest accompanies juicy Mandarin and ripe lemon notes on the vivid nose. There is clarity and precision on the concentrated yet utterly fluid and juicy palate. That zingy, wonderful zestiness also dominates the long, mouthwatering, dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Stadt Krems 2019 Ried Grillenparz Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: A creamy, earthy touch hovers on the nose, blending in with apple flesh and lemon. The palate comes in with ripeness, roundness and vigor but also more of that creaminess. Underneath it all there is a wonderful vein of lemon that is the guiding light until the very long finish. Concentration and texture enhance each other here, all homing in on that citrus zestiness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Malat 2019 Ried Pfaffenberg Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: Both honeyed richness and zesty lemon notes play on the intense nose. The rounded but zesty palate reverberates with juicy Mirabelle notes, adding in a spicy edge of crushed citrus leaf. The palate is concentrated yet honed by lasting acidity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Proidl 2019 Ried Ehrenfels Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: A flinty touch of reduction accompanies the lemon notes on the wine's nose. The palate comes with immediate clarity and brightness that underlines the vivid citrus freshness at the very core. This is bright and juicy, streamlined and utterly refreshing, always reverberating with fine lemony pithiness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tegernseerhof 2019 Ried Kellerberg Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

Description: A slight yeasty funkiness amid the lemon note on the nose notes the utter youthfulness of the wine. The tight, taut, concentrated palate displays stony steeliness that shimmers with both lemon and tangerine zest around its sleek contours. Drink by 2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hiedler 2019 Ried Steinhaus Riesling (Kamptal)

Description: A delicious touch of smoky reduction still swings on the wine's nose, standing as a promise for longevity. The palate takes this smokiness and wraps it in purest, pristine lemon freshness. This is slender, poised and despite its tone and muscle, dances on tiptoe.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Allram 2019 Ried Heiligenstein Riesling (Kamptal)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a compelling and intriguing scent of beach sand on the nose of this bottling, as well as aromas of seared orange, Meyer lemon, baked apple and wax. Zippy acidity kicks off the palate, where flavors run from seared lemon to orange peel. But the texture is the star here, proving both viscous yet edgy. Drink through 2038.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tatomer 2018 Kick-on Ranch Riesling (Santa Barbara County)

Description: A beautifully zesty perfume is still tentative on the nose but undoubtedly there, speaking of orange and tangerine peel. The palate then gives it full rein, augmenting it with a salty touch that intensifies that aromatic citrus peel richness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Zull 2019 Ried Innere Bergen Riesling (Niederösterreich)

Description: Tangerine, Mandarin and ripe Amalfi lemon are subtle on the wine's scented nose. More air introduces a hint of crushed citrus leaf, too. The palate is juicy, bold and has a beautiful vein of entirely pleasant, pithy bitterness—accentuating that citrus feeling even more. There is flow and concentration, freshness and verve.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jäger 2019 Ried Steinriegl Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

Description: This complex and heady Riesling from 90-year-old vines is a bargain. Pale gold in hue, the nose is an expressive perfume of beeswax, crushed stone, candied ginger, honey, tea tree oil and lime leaf. For all its richness on the nose, the palate is bone dry yet highly textural in a skinsy bite. Mouthwatering acidity, juicy fruit and a long finish make for an opulent yet poised Riesling that's drinking beautifully right now.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Powell & Son 2018 Riesling (Eden Valley)

Description: A yeasty funk infiltrates the soaring tangerine notes on the nose, pointing to its youthfulness. The citrus theme continues on the palate where we have the same youthful yeastiness adding some flesh to the zesty body. This is slender yet concentrated, with citric verve and pithiness making it utterly refreshing. The finish is lip-smacking and pristine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Ried Steiner Kögl Alte Reben Reserve
Name: Salomon-Undhof 2019 Ried Steiner Kögl Alte Reben Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: Just a lick of reductive flint still plays on the citrusy nose. The palate reveals a riper streak of tangerine and Mandarin, as well as lovely, pithy, zesty concentration. Yet there is something light-footed and juicy about this. A fitting composition that unites ease and stoniness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tegernseerhof 2019 Ried Steinertal Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

Description: Both lemon and tangerine rind are evoked on the fresh, slightly perfumed nose where summer blossom also seems to creep in. The palate has ease and ripeness, but also a vein of zesty, almost pithy freshness that underscores a certain stony clarity. Lovely, bright and utterly refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Lagler 2019 Ried Setzberg Federspiel Riesling (Wachau)

Description: Crushed lemon leaf and freshly grated lemon zest make for a lifted and invigorating nose. The palate continues in this pristine, lemony fashion, brimming with mouthwatering freshness and utter charm. It offers taut slenderness with a zingy, bone-dry flavor.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wohlmuth 2019 Kitzeck-Sausal Riesling (Südsteiermark)

Description: Only faint hints of citrus peel come to the fore on the shy nose, showing touches of grapefruit and Mandarin. The palate is clear, fluid, energetic and vivid. It is juicy yet well balanced by vibrant acidity. It is the long, zesty finish that really gets you with its enticing aromatics.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Stift Göttweig 2019 Ried Silberbichl Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: The mere scent of grapefruit peel rising from the glass is sufficient to make the mouth water in anticipation. The palate adds ripe, juicy tangerine and Mandarin to make this even racier and juicier. This is pure, vivid, smooth but oh-so zesty, with a deep well of citrus at the core.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Türk 2019 Ried Kremser Wachtberg Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: A subtle sense of fresh lemon zest is tentative on the shy nose. The palate adds a pithier note and gives this a real zesty core. This seems light but is anchored in stone and plenty of citric depth.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Winzer Krems 2019 Kremser Kreuzberg Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: Only faint hints of citrus peel come to the fore on the shy nose, showing touches of grapefruit and Mandarin. The palate is clear, fluid, energetic and vivid. It is juicy yet well balanced by vibrant acidity. It is the long, zesty finish that really gets you with its enticing aromatics.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Stift Göttweig 2019 Ried Silberbichl Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: The mere scent of grapefruit peel rising from the glass is sufficient to make the mouth water in anticipation. The palate adds ripe, juicy tangerine and Mandarin to make this even racier and juicier. This is pure, vivid, smooth but oh-so zesty, with a deep well of citrus at the core.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Türk 2019 Ried Kremser Wachtberg Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: A wonderfully promising, yeasty, reductive funk hangs over the nose. More air slowly reveals the subtle citrus that comes into full flow on the slender, juicy, precise palate. This has clarity, depth and mouthwatering citrus freshness. The finish unites lemon and tangerine in juicy heights.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Buchegger 2018 Ried Moosburgerin Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Entirely steel-tank fermented, this white is crisp and clearly focused in layers of fennel, apple, lemon and apricot. Fresh and complex, it stands well on its own yet should be a beautiful companion to many meals.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Trefethen 2019 Estate Grown Dry Riesling (Oak Knoll District)

Description: The scent of freshly cut Navel orange fills the nose with a zesty, ripe feeling. On the palate, that vivid lift is augmented by bright lemon. The body is juicy and round but streamlined and a perfect marriage of orange and lemon notes.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Diwald 2019 Ried Goldberg Riesling (Wagram)

Description: Notes of bright citrus, wax, kerosene, flower blossoms and honey lead into a bone-dry palate that's fruit-driven, steering it away from overt austerity. Tangy fruit, crunchy acidity, a slippery texture and a mouthwatering finish all work in harmony with one another, making it hard to resist another sip. Drink now–2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Pikes 2019 Traditionale Dry Riesling (Clare Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Precise aromas of Key lime sorbet, lychee and a hint of tonic show on the inviting nose of this bottling. A botanical cinchona kick is on the palate as well, layered into aromas of lemon verbena, green herbs and white flowers, with fresh acidity throughout.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tessier Winery 2018 Zabala Vineyard Riesling (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Meyer lemon peel, wet gravel and a hint of petrol show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression, all hinting at a very tense palate. Indeed, the tightly woven mouthfeel is prominent, carrying flavors of brisk and taut lemon peel and struck stone that ride the compelling texture deep into the finish. Drink now through 2038.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tatomer 2018 Oliver's Riesling (Edna Valley)

Description: The faintest note of crushed passion fruit leaf haunts the lemony nose of this wine. On the palate a zesty lemon note that takes over, pervading everything with its tangy, juicy and mouthwatering freshness. This is all about the purity of ripe Amalfi lemon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2019 Riesling (Niederösterreich)

Description: The most subtle zestiness plays enticingly on the nose, suggesting lime and tangerine. The palate comes in with a slight spritz and a light, juicy sweeping body of ripe lemon freshness. This shows clarity and poise.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2019 Ried Alsegg-Hernals Riesling (Vienna)

Description: A ripe Mandarin note rises from the glass, mixing with an accent of passion flower. That ripe citrus juiciness also pervades on the slender palate. This is alive with fruit and utter freshness and goes down far too easily.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Aigner 2019 Ried Weinzierlberg Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: A fragrance that is as sharp as cut glass references conifer, crushed citrus leaf and lemon zest. Everything about this spells slender freshness, precision and purity. There is a certain weightlessness is anchored in the lemony depth.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Schauer 2019 Kitzeck-Sausal Riesling (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This regional blend is an utter steal, revealing how Riesling thrives on the Central Coast for just $25. Fresh aromas of honeydew, Key lime pie, honeysuckle, chalky and iron lead into a vibrant, energetic palate of lychee, cherimoya and grapefruit-peel flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Claiborne & Churchill 2019 Riesling (Central Coast)

Description: A real sense of lemony verve pervades the cooling, smooth blanket of yeastiness that has laid itself over the fresh nose. The palate is slender, vivid and lemony, but infused with a riper aspect, too, almost of Mirabelle plum. There is something light-footed and translucent about this despite its lovely concentration.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Berger 2019 Ried Steingraben Riesling (Kremstal)

Description: Orange and lemon candy notes are vivid on the open nose. The palate has a slight fizziness and a touch of residual sweetness which both help to enhace that candy feeling of sweet-sour fruit gums.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2019 Reserve Passion Riesling (Niederösterreich)

Description: At 125 g/L residual sugar, this dessert wine is sweet but not cloying. Honey and sugar are abundant flavors along with dense, ripe apricot, peach and papaya. It's got the acid backing to keep the palate fresh and clean.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Stratus 2017 Icewine Riesling (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Description: Currently very young, showing restraint and balance, this wine has a long life ahead of it. Delicate aromas of lime, lemon, honeysuckle, orchard blossoms and peach sorbet open the nose. There's a chalky bite to the slippery palate, a focused line of juicy citrus and a lengthy, mouthwatering finish. Drink now–2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Penfolds 2020 Bin 51 Riesling (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very fresh and focused on the nose, this bottling begins with aromas of lime peel, wet granite, chilled honeydew and light jasmine on the nose. It's bright and zesty with acidity on the palate, showing flavors of Cara Cara orange and citron, as well as a cement-like minerality.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tatomer 2018 Steinhugel Riesling (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very fresh and focused on the nose, this bottling begins with aromas of lime peel, wet granite, chilled honeydew and light jasmine on the nose. It's bright and zesty with acidity on the palate, showing flavors of Cara Cara orange and citron, as well as a cement-like minerality.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tatomer 2018 Steinhugel Riesling (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Description: Part of the Stratus Vineyards group, this is off dry but not particularly sweet. There's a nice tang to the mix of lemon, orange, pink grapefruit and nectarine fruit. Finished with 17 g/L of residual sugar.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Charles Baker 2017 Picone Vineyard Riesling (Vinemount Ridge)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Waxy and tart, this white is also grippy and textured, with dry, fresh layers of complex structure and length. Green apple and lemon wrap around a mineral-laden core of earthiness that adds to its appeal.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Eleven Eleven 2019 Destin Estate Riesling (Oak Knoll District)

Description: This tiny-production white opens impressively with a waxy nose of varietal goodness, following through with sharp flavors of green apple and lemon crisp. Dry and tart on the palate, it finishes clean and fresh.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Thirty-Seven 2018 Riesling (Petaluma Gap)

Description: Part of the Stratus Vineyards group, this is off dry in style. It's loaded with ripe flavors of peach and other stone fruits, with a slightly grainy texture. Finished with 20 g/L of residual sugar, bright acidity keeps it in good proportion for enjoying as an aperitif or with a fruit-driven entrée.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Charles Baker 2019 Riesling (Twenty Mile Bench)

Description: This cuvée is a zingy, regionally expressive drop. Bright notes of apple, lemon and lime are underscored by honey and spice. Rapier-like acidity dominates the palate, but there's plenty of fruit here, too. Balance it out with a Thai curry or an equally spicy, creamy dish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Pikes 2019 Hills & Valleys Riesling (Clare Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The back label indicates this is medium sweet, but it is so perfectly balanced between sugar and acid that it seems just barely off dry and could well accompany a spicy Thai noodle dish or other peppery entrée. Honeysuckle, juicy apple and a touch of white peach all come through in a round and smooth wine with instant appeal. The finish remains bright and tangy.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2019 Riesling (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This single-vineyard estate wine is bursting with delicious peach, pear and apricot fruit. It's fleshy and forward, mouthfilling and simply irresistible. The low alcohol suggests that it retains a bit of residual sugar, but it remains dry and suitable for a wide variety of food pairings.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Eola Hills 2019 Riesling (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: From the mountain appellation, this crisp white is adorned in stone fruit and lemon pith and is dry and fresh in acidity. With a length of grippy texture, it finishes in a lovely note of apricot.                      Virginie Boone
Name: V. Sattui 2019 Dancing Egg Riesling (Mount Veeder)

Description: Peach, apricot and pear flavors combine around the crisp palate of this white wine from a famous site. It finishes on a rich tone of vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bouchaine 2018 Las Brisas Vineyard Riesling (Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a richer expression on the nose of this bottling, which offers hints of smoke, plumeria and orange bubblegum on the nose. The sweet flavors of orange cream and pound cake are pleasant and brushed slightly with wood spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2019 Riesling (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is semisweet despite the “dry” label and quite aromatic, displaying petrol, pine and apple aromas, plus peachy flavors on a pretty rich texture that's mouthcoating. It's fragrant and flavorful.                      Jim Gordon
Name: V. Sattui 2019 Dry Riesling (North Coast)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bone dry (as labeled), this is a slap-in-the-face blast of tart apple-cider flavors. Highlights of lemon rind and lemon oil speak to the acidity. It seems custom-made for shellfish and mollusks.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Project M 2018 Schlüssel Riesling (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is vibrantly aromatic, with notes of jasmine, honeysuckle, white peach and dried rose petal. Plentiful off-dry Nestea Iced Tea flavors follow, with abundant acidity to stand it up. The finish carries.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lone Birch 2019 Estate Grown Riesling (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Quite dry and astringent, this favors flavors of skin and rind rather than flesh and fruit. Lemon and grapefruit, along with bracing minerality, make this a match for salty sea fare.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Reustle 2018 Prayer Rock Vineyards Riesling (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of flower, ripe peach, lime leaf and dried orange peel. Just a hair off-dry stone fruit flavors follow. Lime notes linger on the finish. Impressive acid backs it up. The flavor concentration doesn't seem all there at times, but what is pleases.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Elevation Cellars 2019 Imperium Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh green- and red-pear flesh and peel aromas meet with lime sorbet and guava peel on the nose of this bottling. The palate is zesty with orange and apple-juice flavors, reminiscent of the original High Five fruit drink, and finishes with apparent sweetness.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: SeaGlass 2019 Riesling (Central Coast)

Description: This wine opens with a deeply earthy, waxy nose, aromas that lead to flavors of sour lemon candy and green apple. Intensely acid-driven on entry, it softens on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hagafen 2018 Riesling (Coombsville)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A quick sniff brings hints of powdered sugar and lemon oil. In the mouth, the wine quickly turns thin, almost watery, with simple flavors of lemon and nectarine, so light as to vanish quickly.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Schmidt 2019 Reserve Riesling (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Compelling aromas of marmalade, honey, lemon and ginger lead to rich, mouthcoating, exquisitely balanced fruit flavors. The intensity is outrageous, but it's the balance and endless finish that separates this wine—a true accomplishment of sheer enjoyment. Best after 2024.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle & Dr. Loosen 2012 Eroica Single Berry Select Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of jasmine, apple, honey and light petrol show on the nose of this bottling from a pioneering Riesling property. The palate is both crisp and oily, offering flavors of lime peel and citrus jelly as well as guava and plumeria.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Claiborne & Churchill 2018 Claiborne Vineyard Estate Dry Riesling (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tight aromas of lime, grapefruit and rainy cement show on the nose of this brisk bottling.
