There's a flash of sweetness on the palate but it tightens quickly around nectarine, peach and seared orange flavors, extending into a very long and textural finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Talley 2019 Riesling (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of dried and wet grass, pomelo zest, lime peels and dried seaweed show on the nose of this bottling. There's a flash of richness on the palate before the green-peppercorn, Mandarin orange and light dairy flavors come across the sizzling texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tatomer 2018 Vandenberg Riesling (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intriguing aromas of honey, lemon, citrus pith, tangerine paste and white flowers show on the nose of this bottling. There is ample acidiy to the palate, yet the mouthfeel remains viscous, offering hints of petrol, lemon peel and orange cream on this smooth, weighty expression.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wolff 2017 Riesling (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas intoxicate, with notes of white peach, lime, jasmine and flower. Off-dry leaning sweeter stone fruit and Nestea Lemon Iced Tea flavors follow, with a strong sense of acidity threading through it. The balance and intensity are exquisite. It's everything one could want from this variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2019 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are charming, with notes of lime leaf, white peach and wet rock. Just off-dry lemon iced tea flavors follow. It's a lovely expression of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2019 Cold Creek Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Rather rich in mouthfeel but also tangy, this orange wine shows a true-to-type brassy color and offers ripe peach and floral aromas followed by mild orang- zest and dried apricot flavors. It dampens the typical varietal flavors, but is well made, fun and different.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bannister 2018 Cole Ranch Riesling (Mendocino County)

Description: The lifted perfume of whole candied tangerines rises softly from the glass but becomes more intense with air. The palate then completes this picture and presents the vivid, alluring citrus headiness of candied tangerine, orange and Mandarin orange. Every atom of sweetness carries aroma, and all is etched precisely by the thrilling freshness of the concentrated acidity. The purity of the fruit is astonishing and luminous.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Nigl 2018 Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Niederösterreich)

Description: Ephemeral compared with grand cru expressions from the Mosel that are increasingly stout, this finely etched dry Riesling offers invigorating lemon and yellow-plum flavors layered in smoke, flint and dusty minerals. It's lithe but silky, too, with a bracing steel edge. Tasted in 2020, it's brilliantly fresh. Should continue to improve well through 2035 and hold further still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Van Volxem 2016 Goldberg GG Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Cherry blossoms and white peach perfume this svelte, silken grand cru Riesling. It's luminously fruity but bone-dry in style and edged by cooling tones of steel and stone. Delicious already in its youth, but concentrated and composed to improve for the next few decades.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Johannisberger 2017 Silberlack GG Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Wafting of spring blossoms, smoke and raspberry brambles, this is such a delicately perfumed Riesling. It's slim in profile but beautifully defined, etched by layers of luminous white peach and grapefruit along with a bold, intensely slaty core. It's quiet in youth but should gain depth well through 2030 and hold further still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Johannisberger 2018 Silberback Trocken GG Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: A hint of candied lemon zest precedes the fresh brioche notes on the nose. A multitude of lively but miniscule bubbles then create a sense of gorgeous creaminess, seemingly carrying a burst of lemon in each atom. A smooth, yeasty texture adds depth and underlines both slenderness and purity of this elegant, grown up Sekt. The bone-dry finish is lasting and makes you want to take another sip.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Zuschmann-Schöffmann 2015 Grosse Reserve Riesling Extra Brut Riesling (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: Intense aromas of sunbaked slate and cut stone lend a savory, mineral edge to bright pineapple and yellow peach in this thrilling Riesling. Just a sliver off-dry and medium-bodied in style, it's a penetrating, zippy sip with a long, delightfully salty finish. Drinks beautifully in its youth but should improve well past 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Günther Steinmetz 2017 Piesporter Treppchen von den Terrassen Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Bold notes of yellow peach, mango and anise perfume the nose of this intense, electric Spätlese from the Premier Cru Roxheimer Berg Vineyard. Ripe stone fruit and pineapple flavors penetrate deeply on the palate, accentuated by a truly spine-tingling kick of acidity. It's delightfully zippy and delicately sweet through a long, steely finish. Great already but should improve for another decade and hold further still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Prinz Salm 2017 Berg Roxheim Spätlese Riesling (Nahe)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This reserve-level blend is in top form in 2018, with a rich and complex mix of citrus and tree fruits, both flesh and skin. Highlights of wet stone offer a strong mineral texture that penetrates through the long, clean, inviting finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brooks 2018 Ara Riesling (Willamette Valley)

Description: Pristine lemon and grapefruit flavors align with a crystalline minerality in this joyfully sweet-tart Riesling. It's a piercing, laser-focused sip catapulted by high-toned acidity and a lingering murmur of cut slate. Already drinking beautiful but will hold up nicely through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Johannisberger 2018 Grünlack Spätlese Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Intensely perfumed with notes of white blossom, struck slate and pristine white grapefruit, there's so much to enjoy just on the nose of this indisputably Mosel Riesling. It's a featherlight, racy sip that stuns the palate with electric shocks of lemon and lime and a smoky, petrichor finish. Just a touch of sweetness lingers. Gorgeous in its youth but sure to evolve beautifully through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Günther Steinmetz 2017 Wintricher Geierslay GW Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Wines from the famed Scharzhofberger Vineyard are always a treat to taste. Laser edged and gorgeously complex, they are a fine expression of the blue slate slopes of this cool, high-altitude vineyard of the Saar. With its intensely mineral, smoky nose and luminous white peach and yellow plum flavors, this bottling does not disappoint. Just a half-degree lower in alcohol than the producer's Scharzhofberger Kabinett, it's a richer, more vinous sip with an unctuousness on the palate that lingers long.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2019 Scharzhofberger Spätlese Saar Riesling (Mosel)

Description: From nose to finish, this is such a pure, crystalline Kabinett. Brilliant white peach and grapefruit flavors have a steely, mineral filigree and an acidic spine that's electrifying. Delightful already but should gain complexity well through 2030 and hold further still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Robert Weil 2018 Kabinett Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Intensely spicy on the nose, this spirited off-dry Riesling is an apt introduction to the red and brown slate soils of the Ayler Kupp Vineyard. It's vibrantly peachy and cut by a zesty tangerine spine, but deeply earthen, too, finishing on persistent notes of cut slate and dusty minerals. Best now–2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2019 Ayler Kupp Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Perfumed notes of guava, mango and tangerine introduce this tropical but spry Kabinett. It's delicately sweet but refreshingly tart, too, offsetting luscious peach and yellow cherry flavors against strikes of lime and lemon acidity. The finish is long, lingering on notes of sweet peach and slate. Irresistible now, it should continue to drink well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2019 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Dusty shards of slate and lime zest introduce this thrilling, spine-tingling Kabinett. It's delicately sweet but balanced seamlessly by crisp, cutting tones of lemon and grapefruit acidity. A sprightly, invigorating sip that's full of nervous tension now but should drink beautifully through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Johannisberger 2018 Rotlack Kabinett Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Pert white grapefruits and lemons are dusted by slate and salt in this vivacious Kabinett. It's a thrilling shock of lime and steel on the palate, edged by a lingering but judicious sweetness. It drinks beautifully now, but should hold well through 2029.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Vollrads 2019 Estate Kabinett Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Honey and smoke introduce this dry, moderately full-bodied Riesling. It's an invigorating sip juxtaposing sharp, laser-edged acidity against a silky, supple palate full of juicy white peach and mango flavors. The finish is a long, electric tingle lingering on notes of cut stone. Delightful in youth but should drink well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Nik Weis Mehringer Alte Reben Ortswein
Name: St. Urbans-Hof 2018 Nik Weis Mehringer Alte Reben Ortswein Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Intensely smoky, stony mineral tones meld into crisp white grapefruit in this fruity, finessed Spätlese. Semi-dry in style but pertly balanced, the palate offers sweet-tart bites of citrus flavors etched with a crystalline purity. Delightful now but concentrated enough to gain complexity well through 2030 and hold further still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domdechant Werner 2018 Hochheimer Hölle Spätlese Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Wet stone and smoke mingle into bites of pithy lime and lemon in this light-footed but seductive Riesling. True to its feinherb style, there's just a whisper of sweetness here balancing out electrifying jolts of acidity, earth and green apple on the palate. A delightful wine in its youth that should drink well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Johannisberger 2018 Gelback Feinherb Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: There's no telling how much longer these old vines, planted in the early 1970s, will last. This is a landmark wine for Oregon, one of a vanishing breed. It's finished dry and tart, with lip-licking lemon, grapefruit and green apple crunch and bite. Let it breathe and flavors of pear and lemongrass develop, with a lasting scent of honeysuckle.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Hyland 2019 Old Vine Single Vineyard Riesling (McMinnville)

Description: The Majorat is an exciting addition to the increasingly strong array of Riesling Sekt available stateside. This offers gorgeously cutting notes of tart Mirabelle plum, green apple and lemon catapulted by racy streaks of acidity and a subtle whiff of brioche. A proper brut style with subtle sweetness, it's an elegant sparkling marked by fine effervescence and a delicate mousse. At peak now–2027 but should hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2017 Majorat Brut Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Wet stone and smoke mingle into bites of pithy lime and lemon in this light-footed but seductive Riesling. True to its feinherb style, there's just a whisper of sweetness here balancing out electrifying jolts of acidity, earth and green apple on the palate. A delightful wine in its youth that should drink well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Johannisberger 2018 Gelback Feinherb Riesling (Rheingau)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A very fine effort, this way over-delivers for the price. Punchy lemon-lime fruit anchors a dry wine with juicy acidity and pretty accents of clover and stone fruits. The powerful fruit and impressive balance and length all advocate for long-term aging potential.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Firesteed 2019 Riesling (Willamette Valley)

Description: Layers of struck flint and slate penetrate from nose to finish in this irresistibly smoky, spicy wine. Just a shade off-dry, it offers subtle sweetness balanced by spine-tingling acidity and pristine lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors. An unmistakably Mosel expression of Riesling that should drink well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Günther Steinmetz 2017 Brauneberger Juffer Kabinett Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Intensely dusty notes of sunbaked slate and crushed minerals introduce this spine-tingling yet deeply fruity Kabinett. The palate offers just a shimmer of sweetness that dissipates into crisp white peach and grapefruit flavors. The finish is thrilling, lingering on electric shocks of lime and salty minerality. Delicious already but should drink well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2019 Scharzhofberger Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Once again the Bois Joli impresses in a strong Riesling lineup. As shown on the back label scale, it is medium-dry, with round fruit flavors of Meyer lemon, grapefruit and Honeycrisp apple. There's a sweet-tart lemon drop core, and the textures are reflective of the old vines sourced here. It's an all-around lovely bottle with plenty of years of life ahead.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brooks 2018 Bois Joli Vineyard Riesling (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Notes of earth, cut stone and lime extend from nose to finish in this spine-tingling, laser-edged dry Riesling. Sourced from the vines on iron-rich slate of the Brauneberger vineyards, it's a delightfully spicy, smoky wine with an unmistakably Mosel thrill. Delightfully spry in its youth but should drink well through 2025 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Günther Steinmetz 2018 Basilisk Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Bold notes of petrichor and struck flint abound in this intensely ripe but fully dry expression of 50-year-old grapes grown in slate. Flavors of white grapefruit and tart pineapple are juicy on the palate and linger long through a smoldering, smoky finish. Delightful now but should hold well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bastgen 2018 Berncastel-Cueser Weisenstein Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Luminous notes of crisp Mirabelle plum and slate extend from nose to finish in this crystalline dry Riesling. It's a pristine, fresh-fruited wine that offsets juicy grapefruit flavor against layers of smoke and crushed mineral tones. The finish is peppered by lingering hits of salt and spice. Delightful now but should drink well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Vollrads 2019 Volratz Dry Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Whiffs of pristine yellow peach mingle into petrichor and smoke on the nose here. Just a shade off-dry, it's a lip-smacking, spine-tingling Kabinett that juxtaposes zesty peach and pineapple flavors against complex nuances of pollen, dust and slate. The finish is long and intensely mineral. Drinks beautifully now but should hold through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: St. Urbans-Hof 2018 Wiltinger Kabinett Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

Description: Inviting notes of white peach and blossom perfume this featherlight Riesling. Just a whisper off-dry, the palate offers shimmering peach and yellow cherry flavors shaded by smoke, salt and dusty minerals. The lime zest finish is long and dry. Ready now but should drink well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2019 DOM Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: In a widely varied lineup of dry Rieslings, this searingly tart single-vineyard selection stands apart. You'd better be an acid hound if you select this bottle, and if you are you're going to find yourself in acid heaven. Mineral-driven lemon rind flavors buttress a wine as dry as cold stone, yet flavors are dense, lingering and textured. Bring on the raw oysters.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brooks 2018 Orchard Fold Vineyard Riesling (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Whiffs of pollen, crushed earth and tangerine on the nose meld into gloriously sunny peach and apricot on the palate here. Medium-sweet in style, it's a sprightly, spine-tingling sip etched by a lacy fringe of sweetness and zesty lemon-lime acidity. The finish is quite long, accompanied by murmurs of honey, smoke and spice. Lovely already but should drink well through 2030 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Hermann 2018 Erdener Treppchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Pert yellow plum and grapefruit are juxtaposed by sunbaked slate and smoke in this spine-tingling Riesling. Just a touch of sweetness accents zesty lime and lemon flavors, but the palate finishes quite dry on lingering notes of smoke and earth. It's a complex but delightfully easy-quaffing wine best enjoyed now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2019 Fritz Willi Off Dry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Sharply edged and seductively smoky, this medium-dry Kabinett drinks like a feinherb, a few shades drier than the producer's regular Kabinett bottling. Crisp pear, green apple and lime flavors are zesty and spry on the palate. The finish is marked by a shock of lemon-lime acidity and lingering notes of salt and slate. Best now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Vollrads 2019 Estate Kabinett Medium-Dry Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Zesty notes of pineapple, tart peach and grapefruit are etched with crushed slate and smoke in this zingy Kabinett. Lip-smacking honey-lemon sweetness is juxtaposed by tangs of steel and high-toned acidity on the palate. Irresistibly spry but packs a big finish. Best now–2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2019 Graacher Himmelreich Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Earthen notes of slate and smoke entice on the nose of this classically Saar, intensely mineral Riesling. Dry in style and exceptionally light on its feet, it offers piercing lime and quince flavors filigreed by steel and stone. The finish dazzles with a margarita-like kick of salt and lime zest. Ready now but should drink well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Willems-Willems 2017 Saar Schiefer Oberemmel Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Ripe and dry, this shows a bit more of a fleshy character, with red apple fruit lightly dusted with cinnamon. It's a touch rounder than simply bone-dry, slotting somewhere between the winery's Orchard Fold and Bois Joli bottlings in style.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brooks 2018 Brooks Estate Vineyard Riesling (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Pretty notes of white peach and lemon zest intensify from nose to palate in this radiant dry Riesling. Medium-bodied yet delightfully sprightly, it's a zesty, lip-smacking wine edged by a steely, mineral undertone. Ready to enjoy now but should hold through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2019 DOM Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is medium-dry, as indicated on the back label Riesling scale, and it hits that pleasant sweet-tart borderline with a mix of apricot, Meyer lemon, peach and pear fruit flavors. It's a bit of a fruit salad, with lively acidity keeping it fresh and forward throughout.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lady Hill 2018 Riesling (Willamette Valley)

Description: Crisp, tart pear and white grapefruit aromas mingle into lime and lemon on the palate of this invigorating dry Riesling. It's a zippy, electric sip highlighted by strikes of steel and slate. The finish lingers on murmurs of smoke and tea tannins. Delightful young but should drink well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2019 Fritz Willi Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

Description: There's a smoky, mineral appeal to the nose of this laser-edged Auslese. It's decadently sweet, chock-full of juicy white grapefruit, lemon and tangerine flavors, but invigorating, too. The finish is piercing, lingering on spine-tingling strikes of acidity and salt. Lovely now but should drink well through 2028.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ulrich Langguth 2018 Piesporter Günterslay Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Struck slate, white peach and grapefruit collide in this dry but intensely honeyed Riesling. It's a full-bodied, surprisingly voluptuous wine marked by pristine lemon and stone fruit flavors along with earthier notes of pollen and saffron, too. The finish lingers on a pleasantly bitter grip.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg GG
Name: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg GG Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Perfumed notes of yellow cherry and peach introduce this sun-kissed Premier Cru Riesling. Semi-dry in style, the palate offers delicate streaks of tangerine and hibiscus nectar balanced by zippy lime acidity. While delightful young, it should gain earthen complexity through 2035.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fitz-Ritter 2018 Dürkheimer Hochbenn Spätlese Erste Lage Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Sweet apples and peaches streaked with honey and caramel are the highlights here. Though it carries 230 g/L of residual sugar, it retains significant acidity, enough to put a lemony tang on the trailing finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Inniskillin 2018 Icewine Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

Description: The nose opens with a mellow sense of creaminess. This is intensified on the palate where a notion of lemon yogurt fills the mouth while creamy foam makes the lemon notion dance amid the buffered freshness. Zesty highlights and a dry finish create a Sekt that is both mellow and superfresh. A lovely combo.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Zuschmann-Schöffmann 2017 Klassik Riesling Extra Brut Riesling (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: Leeuwin's latest Riesling release is a bright and ultraracy bottling. It opens with a lemony zing, accompanied by waxy lime leaf, fresh ginger and a touch of salty reduction. The palate is bone dry and chalky textured, with rapier acidity. This might be a tad on the lean and mean side for some American palates but those acidity-loving Riesling lovers will dig it. Plus, it should cellar rather nicely. Drink now with food until 2030 at least.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Leeuwin Estate 2019 Art Series Riesling (Margaret River)

Description: Dusty mineral notes introduce this subtle, mineral Auslese. It's a richly honeyed, lusciously textured sip marked by pert lime and green apple flavors and balanced by firm strikes of acidity. The finish lingers on alternating waves of tart green fruit and earthen minerality. A bit nervous in its youth but should improve through 2030 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domdechant Werner 2018 Hochheimer Hölle Auslese Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Tropical flavors of pineapple, mango and guava explode in this lip-smacking medium-sweet Riesling. It's breathtakingly fruity but finessed, too, etched by veins of smoke, struck flint and dazzling lime acidity. Electric on the palate, it's a wine that impresses now but should continue to improve for at least a decade.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese
Name: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2018 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: This is a gorgeously smoky, stony wine that juxtaposes pert white grapefruit and quince flavors against loads of crushed mineral complexities. Light-bodied but fully dry, it's a zesty, revitalizing sip to enjoy as you would Muscadet or Chablis at a raw bar or seafood bake. Best now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Weingut Georg Albrecht Schneider 2017 Vom Kalk Niersteiner Trocken-Dry Kabinett Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: Whiffs of steel and smoke introduce this very angular dry Riesling. Sourced from loess soils, it's a mineral-focused wine accented by spine-tingling lime and lemon acidity. An excellent value pairing with oysters or raw fish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Eck 2018 Vom Löss Dry Riesling (Pfalz)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Succulent, dry and tangy, this bring zippy citrus fruit flavors of grapefruit and tangerine. It's refreshing and well balanced, with just enough residual sugar to offset the searing acidity.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Kudos 2019 Riesling (Willamette Valley)

Description: An homage to the Grammy-winning jazz orchestra leader Maria Schneider, this fresh-footed Riesling is an excellent introduction to one of the most legendary winegrowers in the Pfalz. Just a shade off-dry, it offers pert white peach and lime flavors etched by a delicate mineral undertone. Tasted in 2020, it's still quite fresh and should drink well through at least 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Von Buhl 2017 Maria Schneider Jazz Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Just a whisper off-dry, this juicy, medium-bodied Riesling offers zesty lime and white melon flavors edged by a touch of tannins. It's a fresh, steely wine that's widely appealing and versatile enough to go from aperitif to dinnertime. Best enjoyed now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domdechant Werner 2018 Classic Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: At 18 g/L of residual sugar and 12.5% abv, this is an unusual example of a lusciously full-bodied but off-dry expression of Mosel Riesling. It owes its structure to intense ripeness that shows through layers of honey, pineapple and yellow peach on the palate. The finish is marked by hints of saffron and honeycomb.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Sorentberg 2016 Rotschiefer Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Pronounced notes of wet stone and smoke linger from nose to finish in this dry, full-bodied Riesling. It's a solidly structured, stately wine marked by restrained green plum and pear flavors amplified by a bold, mineral backbone. The finish is long and wraps up on a pleasant fringe of bitters. Best now–2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Louis Guntrum 2016 Oppenheimer Sackträger Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: Crushed minerals and plush white peach aromas introduce this juicy, intensely fruity Spätlese. It's a concentrated sip full of juicy yellow peach and dried mango flavors, but there's a thrilling grip of tea tannins that lends a bit of structure, too. Fresh acidity leaves a clean finish. Drink now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Paul Anheuser 2018 Kreuznacher Kahlenberg Spätlese Gutsabfüllung Riesling (Nahe)

Description: Big, bold aromas of grapefruit, blossom and tangerine perfume this buoyantly fruity Riesling. It's subtly sweet but refreshingly balanced on the palate. A juicy, endlessly easy quaffing white that finishes with a cut of minerality. Best enjoyed now–2023 for its youthful flamboyance.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2019 DOM Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Despite the low alcohol, this bears no trace of sugar. It's clean, fresh and dry, with edge-of-ripe flavors of citrus rind and green apple fruit. The density and definition bring it up to the 90 point score.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brooks 2018 Wascher Vineyard Riesling (Dundee Hills)

Description: Classically Mosel notes of crushed slate and smoke accent juicy white peach and pear in this dry, steel-tipped Riesling. Medium-bodied but spine-tingling and mineral, it's an invigorating sip to enjoy now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2018 Ürziger Würzgarten Dry Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Hints of lime sherbet and green plum introduce this lip-smacking Riesling. It's pristine, citrusy flavors and juicy demeanor make it especially easy drinking. Medium-sweet in style, it offers judicious sweetness offset by a cutting lemony finish. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Vollrads 2019 Estate Qualitätswein Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Pretty whiffs of white peach and apricot introduce this delightfully zesty white. True to the feinherb style, there's just a sizzle of sweetness on the palate here that melds seamlessly into veins of salt, lemon-lime acidity and smoke. A delightfully thirst-quenching sip that finishes on a lingering, softly peachy note.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2019 Schiefer Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Dusty mineral notes and crisp white pear and peach introduce this bold, juicy Kabinett. Just a shade off-dry and weighty on the palate, it's a substantial sip loaded with racy lime and lemon flavors and a pleasant grip of tannins on the finish. Delightful now but will hold well through 2028.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: August Kesseler 2018 R Kabinett Gutswein Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Pristine gooseberry and white grapefruit are accented by struck flint and smoke in this fully dry, intently mineral white. Medium-bodied and svelte on the palate, it finishes on a lingering lime-pith twist.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: Alte Reben Enkircher Ellergrub Spätlese Trocken
Name: Ulrich Langguth 2017 Alte Reben Enkircher Ellergrub Spätlese Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Subtle notes of smoke, pear and lemon perfume this intensely lemony white. Semi-dry in style, it's a zesty, spine-tingling sip edged by a rim of minerality. Balanced in sweetness and marked by a prickle of effervescence on the finish, it's a bottle to enjoy young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2018 RK Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Hints of earth and smoke meld into pristine white grapefruit in this racy, light-footed dry Riesling. Lean and quite linear in style, it would be perfect as an accompaniment to soft cheese or raw seafood. Best now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Nägler 2018 Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland Kabinett Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: Aromatic white peach and honeysuckle extend from nose to finish in this pretty, easy-drinking Riesling. Its subtle, balanced sweetness make it a universally approachable sip, but it's elegant, too, offering concentrated white grapefruit flavors framed by a lingering, steely finish. Best now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Single Post 2019 Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Crushed minerals and river rocks lend elegance to pristine, juicy flavors of lemon, lime and yellow cherry on the palate of this zesty off-dry Riesling. It's a lip-smacking, spine-tingling sip with balanced sweetness. Best now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Weingut Georg Albrecht Schneider 2018 Niersteiner Paterberg Kabinett Estate Bottled Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: Smoky mineral notes and racy lemon-lime flavors meld well in this medium-bodied, fully dry Riesling. While a bit more rounded on the palate compared with its zippier 2017 bottling, it's a fantastic value for an elegant white wine.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Weingut Georg Albrecht Schneider 2018 Vom Kalk Niersteiner Trocken-Dry Kabinett Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: This sunshine-infused South Aussie Riesling wraps ripe lemon, stone fruit and florals into a slippery texture, crisp, bright acidity, and what feels like a hint of residual sugar. A refreshing, straightforward but balanced drop.                      Christina Pickard
Name: D'Arenberg 2019 The Dry Dam Riesling (Adelaide)

Description: Fresh lemon and white grapefruit are edged by smoke and struck flint in this spicy, spine-tingling sip. It's medium-sweet in style but vibrantly cut by shards of lime acidity and a lingering, steely finish. An invigorating value Riesling best enjoyed now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Prinz Salm 2018 Two Princes Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This well-rounded, juicy and fresh-tasting wine carries vivid peach and apricot flavors on a surprisingly light body. It tastes sunny, dry, and nicely concentrated, and will be easy to enjoy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Read Holland 2019 Wiley Vineyards Riesling (Anderson Valley)

Description: Classic Aussie Riesling citrus-and-floral notes kick off this Eden Valley bottling. It's also a touch reductive, with rubber, kerosene and white spice tones. The palate presents a lovely crunch of acidity and a talc-like texture. Delicate citrus and floral notes linger to finish. Drink now–2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Kellermeister 2019 The Wombat General Hand Picked Riesling (Eden Valley)

Description: This ripe Riesling offers pleasant tones of tropical and stone fruit, waxy green apple, cherry blossom and honey. The palate feels like there's a touch of residual sugar, but it's well balanced and the acidity is in check. It's a straightforward but likable bottling.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Kilikanoon 2019 Killerman's Run Riesling (Clare Valley)

Description: Crushed minerals and subtle smoke from nose to palate in this taut, steely wine. Despite its “semi-dry” labeling, it tastes just a whisper off-dry. Juicy lemon and lime flavors make it an excellent meeting point for lovers of dry or sweet wines. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Eck 2018 Vom Löss Semi-Dry Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Just a shade off-dry, this reliably tasty, fresh-fruited Riesling offers easy, ample yellow peach and lemon flavors edged by just a touch of minerality. Best enjoyed young, it's a lovely accompaniment to a summer picnic.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Sun Garden 2018 Riesling (Nahe)

Description: This Clare Valley Riesling opens with a perfume of honeyed pear, ginger, cashews and flint. It's a little on the synthetic side, however. Considering the honeyed nature of the nose, the palate is surprisingly dry. It's waxy in texture with taut, elevated acidity and more citrus and nutty, flinty flavors.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Wakefield 2019 Estate Label Riesling (Clare Valley)

Description: There's a cooling, river-rock minerality that exudes from this light-bodied but fully dry Riesling. The palate offers firm strikes of stone and steel, but also a zippy edge of lime and white grapefruit. A racy white that would accompany raw oysters or other seafood quite well. Drink now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Weingut Binz 2018 Nackenheimer Trocken- Dry Estate Bottled Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are exuberant, with notes of flower, lime and dried Nestea iced tea. It's bone-dry and medium-bodied, with a zing of acidity. It will fit in best at the dinner table.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Wild Type 2017 Dionysus Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Whiffs of smoke and apple introduce this intensely spicy, earthen sip. Semi-dry in style, it's a peppy, light-bodied Riesling chock-full of concentrated pear, apple and lemon flavors. The finish is edged by a hint of bitter tea tannins and lingering earth tones. Best now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: St. Urbans-Hof 2018 Nik Weis Mosel Urban Riesling (Mosel)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried lemon and apple-juice aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a grippy texture to the palate, where more white-fleshed-fruit flavors are cut by orange peel.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Folktale 2018 Riesling (Carmel Valley)

Description: Subtle aromas of crushed stone and pine lend savory, spicy nuances to this medium-sweet Riesling. A slightly earthen expression of the Mosel, it offers zippy lime and lemon flavors followed by a murmur of bitters on the finish. Enjoy young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Saarstein 2018 Riesling (Mosel)

Description: While the nose is shy here, juicy pink grapefruit and mango flavors are forward on the palate of this value Auslese. It's not a deeply complex wine but pertly balanced and shaded by hints of pollen and rocky minerality. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: St. Christopher 2018 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Sun-drenched peaches are speckled by smoke and crushed stone in this lip-smacking off-dry Riesling. Bright, juicy peach and tangerine flavors lend an effortless ease to the palate, but it's a revitalizing sip that finishes on a hint of minerality. A great value for everyday elegance.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Von Der Leyen 2018 Riesling (Nahe)

Description: This is an easy-drinking crowd-pleaser offering crisp white peach and lemon flavors against a backdrop of steely, stony minerality. Light-bodied and fully dry, it's should drink well through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Heyden 2018 Oppenheimer Kabinett Dry-Style Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: Curious hints of smoke and vanilla mingle into fresh white pear and peach in this fruity, easy drinking Kabinett. Just a shade off-dry, it's a comfortable meeting point for those with both dry and sweet preferences. Best enjoyed now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schlink Haus 2018 Kabinett Riesling (Nahe)

Description: Pretty white peach and honeysuckle perfume this juicy, easy-drinking Riesling. It's not a complex wine, but for those who appreciate balanced sweetness and straightforward peachy, citrusy flavors, there's a lot to enjoy here. Drink now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Blue Fish 2018 Sweet Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Whiffs of smoke and sweet spice introduce this dry, full-bodied Riesling. It's quite plush in texture but zesty white grapefruit and lime flavors lend a steeliness throughout. Best enjoyed young but should maintain well through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Desire 2018 Trocken Dry Riesling (Nahe)

Description: Lemon and grapefruit are enticing and fresh on the nose of this juicy, well-balanced white. It tastes off-dry on the palate but not at all sugary, juxtaposing sweet-tart citrus flavors against a clear line of minerality. An elegant bargain bottling for everyday enjoyment.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: HigHDef 2018 Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Notes of honey and pollen on the nose mingle into preserved peach and pink grapefruit on the palate here. Medium-sweet in style, it's a lusciously textured Riesling marked by racy lemon acidity and a rim of tea tannins on the finish. Best enjoyed now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Mönchhof 2017 Riesling (Mosel)

Description: The nose is quite pretty here, suggesting plumes of spring blossoms and sun-kissed peaches. There's nothing complex here, but loads of easy, ample apricot and grapefruit flavors edged by a lingering vein of sweetness. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schlink Haus 2019 Kabinett Riesling (Nahe)

Description: The nose offers subtle lemon and dried herb notes that are magnified on the off-dry palate here. A refreshingly zingy Riesling with just a hint of stony minerality, it's an easy-drinking but elegant sip best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schlink Haus 2017 Made with Organic Grapes Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: While light in body, this is a rich, concentrated Spätlese packed with yellow peach and honey flavors. Medium-sweet and a touch sugary on the finish, it finishes with a pleasant grip of tea tannins. Best now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Dr. Nägler 2017 Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland Spätlese Riesling (Rheingau)

Description: The nose offers subtle lemon and dried herb notes that are magnified on the off-dry palate here. A refreshingly zingy Riesling with just a hint of stony minerality, it's an easy-drinking but elegant sip best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schlink Haus 2017 Made with Organic Grapes Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: A whisper of crushed stone lends just a touch of minerality to this piercing, sweet-tart Auslese. It's a straightforward medium-sweet Riesling with bold, easy flavors of lemon candy and grapefruit nectar. Drink young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schlink Haus 2018 Auslese Riesling (Nahe)

Description: Pleasant hints of white tea and honeydew perfume this soft, easy Spätlese. The palate offers plenty of juicy yellow peach and preserved quince flavors along with a brisk, clean finish. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schlink Haus 2018 Spätlese Riesling (Nahe)

Description: White melon and lemon flavors have a pleasantly candied cling in this fruity, forward Riesling. It's light-bodied and semisweet in style. Tasted in 2020, it's not a complex wine but still tastes youthful and fresh. Enjoy now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Windisch 2016 Mozart Niersteiner Auflangen Spätlese Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: Whiffs of salt and slate on the nose lend some elegance to this pert, easy-quaffing Riesling. Flavors of yellow peach and apple are straightforward but fresh, lingering on a sweet-tart, medium-sweet finish. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schmitt Söhne 2019 Crisp & Fruity Riesling (Mosel)

Description: Slightly herbal, earthen notes open into lemon and lime on the palate of this off-dry Riesling. It's not a deeply complex or concentrated wine, but fresh, citrus flavors are refreshing. The finish is marked by a pleasant hint of bitters. Enjoy young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Trullo 2018 Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: A whiff of lime sorbet introduces this fresh, citrusy Riesling. It's medium-sweet but pertly balanced by lemon, lime and sour tangerine flavors. The finish is a touch candied, but it's a pleasant sip to enjoy young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Gustav Adolf Schmitt 2018 Niersteiner Gutes Domtal Spätlese Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: While the nose is quiet, the palate of this easy-drinking medium-sweet Riesling offers straightforward apple, lemon and grapefruit flavors. It's a zippy, brightly balanced wine with a brisk finish marked by a touch of bitters. Drink young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Von Schleinitz 2018 VS Riesling (Mosel)

Description: A twinge of pollen mingles into sunny honey and tangerine in this sweet, easy-drinking Auslese. It's not complex but offers juicy, fresh citrus flavors and a lip-smacking, slightly sugary finish. Drink young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schlink Haus 2017 Auslese Riesling (Nahe)

Description: Crisp white pear and grapefruit notes are edged by a hint of hazelnut in this easy-drinking, semisweet Riesling. Tasted in 2020, it's plenty fruity still but should be enjoyed soon to maximize its freshness.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Windisch 2017 Niersteiner Auflangen Spätlese Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: A hint of fresh paper lends an earthen note to fresh, juicy lemon and white grapefruit here. While semi-dry in style, there's a slightly candied lemon drop candy tone throughout. The finish is brisk and citrusy. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schlink Haus 2018 Riesling (Landwein Rhein)

Description: Touches of pressed apple and apricot preserves introduce this medium-sweet Riesling. Fruit flavors are a bit treacly on the palate but are offset by sprightly lemon acidity. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Windisch 2018 Niersteiner Ölberg Auslese Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: Plush and easy drinking, this semi-dry Riesling offers soft, slightly candied notes of peach and lemon. It's a fruity, uncomplicated wine that should be enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fritz Windisch 2018 Niersteiner Spiegelberg Kabinett Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: A hint of peach preserve on the nose introduces this slightly confected Riesling. It's abundantly sweet but a bit slight in fruit concentration, suggesting shades of dried apricot and marmalade. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: P.J. Valckenberg 2018 Madonna Auslese Riesling (Rheinhessen)

Description: Just a subtle note of fresh lemon zest appears on this wine's tender nose. The palate comes in delicately, filling the senses with lemon scent while the body remains toned and taut, as though it were a sublimation of the stone from which it sprang. It has power and citrus energy, despite its lithe nature. A delicious, bone-dry contradiction, the wine will evolve for many years.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Cuvée Ste. Cathérine Schlossberg Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2018 Cuvée Ste. Cathérine Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, a heady nose offers dried lemon zest, lemon oil and chalky hayflower. The luscious body flows with almost viscous intensity, vibrating with lemony freshness and concentration amid the candied, sweet richness of the fruit. It's a high-wire act of compelling intensity. Exquisite and exciting now, the wine has enough concentration, acid and sweetness to outlast us all. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2015 Vendanges Tardives Sporen Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Smokiness and the purest note of Amalfi lemon combine into an intriguing aroma on this wine's nose. The palate is a picture of concentrated, ripe lemon, buffered by stony austerity and channeled into the sinuous intensity. Right now this wine brims with youthful fruit, but it also has stony depth. Drink 2025–2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Julien Schaal 2019 Volcanique Rangen Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: The flinty smoke of reduction precedes apple and lemon on the youthful nose of this wine. The palate hits home with a concentrated, heightened juiciness with innate energy and drive. On the midpalate, there's bundled lemon freshness, pithy texture, steely concentration and muscular tone. Quite a powerhouse, the wine is also well proportioned. The finish is bone dry and the concentration promises that this will evolve for decades. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Brand Crand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Initial whiffs of flint, apple and smoke dissipate, leaving this wine with a shy, closed nose. The palate still carries residual carbon dioxide that gives a little spritz but all that is just window dressing for a powerful and concentrated core. Yes, there is concentrated lemon, both peel and pith, but a stony expanse underneath makes this profound, smoky and compelling. The finish is bone dry, bracing and racy. Lemon echoes long, carrying stony heat in its cooling breeze.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: The faintest floral note clings to the pure lemon vividness of this wine. The palate is as taut and tight as the nose suggests, bright with citrus imbued with aromatic dried lemon-rind notions and stony depth. Apple-like juiciness makes the mouth water and propels this wine forward, leaving a ripe note of apple, lemon and an echoing, dry length.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2017 Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Notes of ripe Mirabelle, yellow apple and lemon zest combine into a fruity nose on this wine. More swirls of air add an ethereal herbal note to all this fruit. The palate conveys the full force of the juicy fruit, almost spilling over with energy. Dry, concentrated, vivid and bold, the wine is certain to evolve. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2017 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, an aromatic nose evokes peach and tangerine. The palate sweeps in with concentrated, zesty citrus, framing ripe, peachy fruit with tingling, mouth-watering freshness. Taut and driven, this wine is also stony, elegant and bone dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean Biecher & Fils 2019 Sommerberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Lemon and grapefruit zest are subtle but distinct on this wine's nose. The palate shows immense concentration, centered around vivid citrus zestiness that brightens and tingles on the midpalate. There is something driven and taut here, stony and bold. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2018 Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: This wine's nose is subtle but gently aromatic, with tangerine and a tropical overtone of passionfruit. On the palate the concentration becomes evident. Fruitiness, with zesty, ripe lemon uppermost, seems anchored in coolness, giving this wine a taut, linear and zesty outlook. If you are looking for refreshment, this is it.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Julien Schaal 2019 Schiste Kastelberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Lemon and grapefruit zest are subtle but distinct on this wine's nose. The palate shows immense concentration, centered around vivid citrus zestiness that brightens and tingles on the midpalate. There is something driven and taut here, stony and bold. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2018 Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: On the ethereal nose of this wine, lifted notes of chalk and dried lemon almost carry a hint of fresh suede. The palate comes with concentration and intense saltiness that, together with the lemon intensity, makes the mouth water. This is bold and chalky, with a note of bitter pith and apple pip in its smooth texture. Everything is heightened, yet the endless, dry finish echoes with concentrated lemon freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Clos Saint Landelin Grand Cru Vorbourg
Name: René Muré 2017 Clos Saint Landelin Grand Cru Vorbourg Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Subtle but fresh notes of lemon and lemon zest are subdued on the shy nose of this wine. They also characterize the concentrated palate where they are joined by zesty lemon ripeness. Alive with freshness, this carries a gorgeously bitter note of pith that makes it all the more thrilling. The finish is bright, dry and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean Biecher & Fils 2019 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: The subtle nose of this wine reveals precise, lifted lemon zest. That brightness fills out the streamlined palate with ripe peach but everything happens along that central freshness, yet fully ripe and energetic. The dry, racy finish has a touch of tangerine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Julien Schaal 2019 Calcaire Rosacker Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A reductive, yeasty funk still hangs over citrus notes on the nose of this wine. On the palate, the concentration, power and ripeness of the wine are made clear. Zesty and driven, it brims with ripe lemon peel and pleasantly bitter pith in a focused, energetic package. The intensity is immense. While thrilling now, the wine will only get better.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2018 Brand Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A scented lift of dried lemon peel and crushed chamomile gives headiness and intensity to the wine from the beginning. Although the palate is rich with mellow apple and juicy peach, the generous body tapers towards a bright, central vein of citrus freshness. The beginnings of balm-like texture are aleady there and will deepen with time. On the finish it is dry and intense.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2017 Furstentum Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A note of lemon is all that rises from the glass but the purity of that notion sets the tone. The palate of this wine continues this theme of purity and celebrates it with bouncy juiciness that plays and swirls, while stony depth lies underneath. This wine is juicy, vivid, ripe and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2018 Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: An initial, gentle whiff of green apple on this wine's nose is joined by riper notions of yellow fruit. On the palate the apple freshness is supported by some residual carbon dioxide and its subtle spritz. The fruit becomes rounder, showing notions of Mirabelle edged with lemony brightness and freshness. It's a beautifully proportioned, refined and elegant dry Riesling.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Julien Schaal 2019 Gypse Schoenenbourg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: The aroma of dried lemon rind and an herbal notion of crushed yarrow blend with hints of mellow apple on this wine's nose. The palate is concentrated but svelte. Something gentle and balm-like about it has that sensuous combination of citrus and aromatic herb. This wine is fresh but soothing, with a beautifully dry, intense finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Très Vieilles Vignes Sporen Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2016 Très Vieilles Vignes Sporen Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Green-apple vividness appears first on the fruity nose of this wine. This is followed by mellower notes of ripe peach and Mirabelle that fill the palate with juiciness. Rich and smooth, the wine is edged with zestiness to remain on the refreshing side of ripeness. It brims with concentration and dryness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2017 Brand Crand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A lifted sense of lemon-zest purity precedes juicy lemon and peach notes on this wine's nose. The palate adds crushed yarrow to the lemon-rind concentration that gives it lift and extra aromatic dimension. The body is toned, pervasive and bold. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2018 Eichberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Spicy hayflower can barely impede the ethereal, piercing petrol note on the nose of this wine. The palate then fills with the textured richness of pale sultana, dried apple and dried lemon peel while concentration and drive seem anchored in coolness. Subtle sweetness is countered by immense freshness and carried by substance and concentration. The finish is lasting and totally balanced. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gresser 2015 Moenchberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: The scented, ethereal and almost medicinal headiness of dried, crushed chamomile rises from the glass, folding notions of apple and dried lemon peel in its fragrance. The concentrated and sinuous palate of this wine carries all of these ethereal notions in a streamlined, focused body that is held by citrus freshness. This wealth of flavor leads to a bone-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean Becker 2016 Froehn Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A subtle liftedness reminiscent of crushed chamomile and dried lemon peel shows on the subtle nose of this wine. The concentrated palate has already started evolving towards that balm-like herbal, hayflower and savory theme, enhanced by dried citrus-rind freshness. There is harmonious balance between the aromatic intensity, toned body and searing freshness. The finish is dry and bright.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2017 Mandelberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Hints of summer blossom and tropical overtones appear on this wine's shy nose, but they dissipate quickly. The palate , however, gives a lovely picture of freshness and verve, with a juicy, flowing body anchored in zesty lemon and orange that reside in a concentrated core of cooling freshness. The finish is dry and zesty.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2018 Hengst Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A touch of peach plays around notes of dried lemon rind and crushed chamomile on the vivid nose of this wine. The palate also carries a touch of peachy gentleness, its cushioning ripeness making the lemon rind more pliable and softer. This wine is gentle and caressing but concentrated, capturing both ripeness and rapier freshness. The finish is bone dry and incisive.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2018 Praelatenberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: This wine is shy and subtle on the nose, only giving a vague sense of citrus zest. The palate, however, is a proper picture of abandon, vivid with lemon zest. There is concentration and textured roundness, almost akin to lemon oil, while the finish is dry and lemony. It's beautifully pure and lively.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean Biecher & Fils 2019 Rosacker Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Subtle hints of tangerine and summer blossom hit the nose before the aromas of this wine shut again. The palate, framed by lemon zestiness, presents the rounded ripeness of 2018, offering juicy peach with an earthy edge. Intense zestiness propels this wine forward to a dry, mouthwateringly fresh finish, ringing with lemon zestiness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Julien Schaal 2019 Granite Sommerberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Subtle scent on this wine's nose recalls fresh, ripe lemon peel. On the palate this zesty, lemony intensity carries on in a precise, driven fashion that is energetic and bold but also taut. Zestiness reverberates with its citric freshness and the wine comes across as infinitely cool, despite the warm year. It is bold, concentrated and long with lemon. Just a little heat shows on the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2018 Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A lifted streak of lemon rind immediately signals freshness on this wine's nose. The palate preserves that lemon streak all the way to the dry, tapered and long finish. Along the way the wine is softened by peachy juiciness but its concentration is undoubted.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2018 Trois Châteaux Pfersigberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A distant, gentle note of dried lemon rind appears tentatively on this wine's nose. Nothing is timid on the palate, though. Lemon zestiness swirls around the svelte, concentrated palate with energy and abandon. This wine is vividly concentrated, bone dry and elixir-like.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2018 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Notes of wet earth are suffused with aromas of lemon peel and yellow apple on this wine's open nose. More air adds lifted hints of dried hayflowers. On the precise, concentrated palate, the central shaft of buffered freshness is pervasive and bright. The texture is smooth and rich, but very poised. It finishes dry and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2017 Kanzlerberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A gentle freshness of green and red apples appears on the appetizing nose of this wine. The palate also brims with apple freshness, easy flow and juiciness, with an edge of zestiness and hint of pepper. This wine is fresh but ripe, textured but smooth, and warm but refreshing. The finish is long and bone dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2018 Trois Châteaux Eichberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A touch of summer blossom informs the creamy Mirabelle and orange notes on this wine's attractive nose. The palate comes in with toned slenderness, carrying aromatic riches of orange and tangerine peel. Smooth yet zesty, the wine has a dry, long and refreshing finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2018 Altenberg de Bergbieten Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A touch of summer blossom informs the creamy Mirabelle and orange notes on this wine's attractive nose. The palate comes in with toned slenderness, carrying aromatic riches of orange and tangerine peel. Smooth yet zesty, the wine has a dry, long and refreshing finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2018 Altenberg de Bergbieten Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Yeasty, earthy notes of reduction accompany red-apple-peel notes on this wine's nose, signaling youthfulness and mellowness. On the palate, apple pervades the textured, earthy body with freshness and energy. Pervasive freshness gets even more persistent towards the dry finish, tapering to funky, earthy intensity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2018 Wiebelsberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Subtle tones of freshly cut orange waft from the glass. That gentle citrus tone, augmented on the vivid palate by zesty pithiness, stays throughout and is intensified by the midpalate concentration. The finish is intense, dry and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Anne de K Schlossberg Grand Cru
Name: Bestheim 2018 Anne de K Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Notes of wet earth are suffused with aromas of lemon peel and yellow apple on this wine's open nose. More air adds lifted hints of dried hayflowers. On the precise, concentrated palate, the central shaft of buffered freshness is pervasive and bright. The texture is smooth and rich, but very poised. It finishes dry and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2017 Kanzlerberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A gentle freshness of green and red apples appears on the appetizing nose of this wine. The palate also brims with apple freshness, easy flow and juiciness, with an edge of zestiness and hint of pepper. This wine is fresh but ripe, textured but smooth, and warm but refreshing. The finish is long and bone dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2018 Trois Châteaux Eichberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Fresh green apple flashes up first before riper yellow apple takes over on the nose of this wine, which also has an edge of chamomile. Taut and precise, the palate brims with apple freshness edged with dried chamomile headiness. Concentrated, stony freshness holds everything with poise and energy.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gresser 2018 Kastelberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Juicy, mellow apple, dried apple skin and dried lemon rind make for a rich and mellow nose on this vivid wine. The palate redoubles on creamy, zesty mellowness reminiscent of tart, baked apple flesh. All is made vibrant with lemon acidity and the finish is rounded but bone dry. The wine is intense and rich, but svelte.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean Becker 2016 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A smoky touch of reduction still clings to zesty citrus notions on this wine's nose. The citrus takes over the streamlined, fresh but ripe palate that tingles with lemon-peel intensity. Fresh but ripe, the long finish is alive with that lemon-peel note.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Julien Schaal 2019 Brand Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Fresh green apple flashes up first before riper yellow apple takes over on the nose of this wine, which also has an edge of chamomile. Taut and precise, the palate brims with apple freshness edged with dried chamomile headiness. Concentrated, stony freshness holds everything with poise and energy.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gresser 2018 Kastelberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A gentle note of lemon appears on the subtle nose of this wine. The concentrated palate homes in on lemon freshness that tingles with zestiness. The svelte body has real tone and will beneft from bottle age. An underlying elegance wants to revealed when that first flush of citrus excitement is gone. Drink 2022–2042.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Pfister 2017 Engelberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Cedar Ranch belongs to Foris winery in the Illinois Valley near the California border in southwest Oregon. This outstanding effort is off-the-charts brilliant, finished dry but streaked with honey, almost like a dry mead. It's floral, tangy, delicate and delicious, fermented with wild yeasts in a mix of neutral oak, concrete egg and Austrian casks.                      Paul Gregutt
Designation: Off the Grid Cedar Ranch Vineyard
Name: Ovum 2018 Off the Grid Cedar Ranch Vineyard Riesling (Rogue Valley)

Description: Lifted, almost heady aromas of crushed yarrow and chamomile set an aromatic accent on this wine's nose. These notions become more pronounced on the toned, concentrated palate where they radiate their aromatics, now imbued with juicy peach and vivid lemon. Something smooth and balm-like to the texture tapers into an elegant, suave, dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Sommerberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Lifted, almost heady aromas of crushed yarrow and chamomile set an aromatic accent on this wine's nose. These notions become more pronounced on the toned, concentrated palate where they radiate their aromatics, now imbued with juicy peach and vivid lemon. Something smooth and balm-like to the texture tapers into an elegant, suave, dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Sommerberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This tiny AVA is noted for its cool climate, here showcased in a riper-than-usual, fruit-driven display of pear, peach, papaya and pineapple flavors. As it lengthens into the finish it's apparent that there's much more to it than just the fruit, and it has the acidity, power and grace to age. Drink through 2035.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ovum 2018 Base Line Bradley Vineyard Riesling (Elkton Oregon)

Appellation: Cienega Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From vines planted in 1964, making them the second oldest Riesling in California, this is a revelatory wine. Tense aromas of lime skin, underripe melon, wet gravel, blossoms and fresh grass lead into an extremely textural and tightly wound sip. Flavors of lime peel, mandarin, lemon bar and melon prove both complex yet approachable.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Maidenstoen 2019 Wirz Vineyard Riesling (Cienega Valley)

Description: A gorgeous whiff of smoke is met with expressive orange-peel freshness on the nose of this wine. Crushed citrus foliage adds further aromatic appeal. The palate spreads out with mellow, almost creamy richness, displaying the generosity and power of the vintage, yet always relying on its central core of freshness. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Armand Hurst 2018 Brand Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: An initial, smoky whiff blows off to reveal both fresh and dried lemon zest on this wine's nose. The palate comes with spicy, zesty stoniness, with tone and concentration. There is depth of flavor that echoes with hints of peach and honey framed in vivid lemon freshness. The finish is long and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wolfberger 2017 Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Beautifully pure notions of lime and lemon zest create aromatic, heightened freshness on the nose of this wine. Vivid citrus juiciness on a dry, svelte but sinuous body reverberates with lemon and tangerine. The blend of ripeness and ethereal coolness makes this wine compelling.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Hunawihr 2019 Rosacker Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Juicy notes of peachy richness are bound up in lemon freshness on this wine's very attractive nose. This combination of peachy richness and lemony brightness continues on the toned body that brims with juiciness, freshness and concentration. The finish is dry, intense and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2017 Altenberg-Wolxheim Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: The pervasive, juicy freshness of a still-tart Golden Delicious apple plays on the nose of this wine and continues on the vivid, slightly spicy palate. There is ripe roundness here, but also vivid apple freshness, accentuated by white-pepper notions. The body is flowingly smooth and the finish is appetizing and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Rieflé 2018 Steinert Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of ripe yellow apple, baked apple and apple crumble define this wine's appetizing and open nose. The palate adds a compelling line of bright, searing citrus acidity that streamlines the entire wine while leaving the mellow apple notes intact. This wine is energetic, toned, dry and very long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2017 Kaefferkopf Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: The ethereal headiness of dried, crushed chamomile sets the tone on this concentrated, lemon-scented wine. Vivid, taut and juicy, the palate offers notes of fresh lemon and aromatic, dried lemon peel. Hints of pear peel add texture and make this dry wine pervasive and memorable.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2017 Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Earthiness clings to ripe apple and Mirabelle notes on this wine's nose, enhanced by vivid lemon. The palate is taut and tight, offering lemon zest, apple peel and a notion of crushed yarrow. Flavors almost sizzle with lemony brightness while the finish is dry and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2018 Mandelberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A lifted hayflower notion signals that this wine has begun its evolution. The aromatic headiness on the nose is backed by full-fruited richness on the concentrated palate. Mirabelle plum and dried lemon rind lend perfumed richness and coalesce at the concentrated core that comes to a long, dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2017 Spiegel Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A lifted hayflower notion signals that this wine has begun its evolution. The aromatic headiness on the nose is backed by full-fruited richness on the concentrated palate. Mirabelle plum and dried lemon rind lend perfumed richness and coalesce at the concentrated core that comes to a long, dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2017 Spiegel Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Notions of dried apple peel and lemon rind on this wine's nose spell freshness and ripeness. The palate rounds this out with juicy, ripe Mirabelle and a backdrop of pithy, zesty texture. Concentrated, dry, lasting and aromatic, the wine is laden with citrus until the last.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Philippe Sohler 2017 Muenchberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Earthiness clings to ripe apple and Mirabelle notes on this wine's nose, enhanced by vivid lemon. The palate is taut and tight, offering lemon zest, apple peel and a notion of crushed yarrow. Flavors almost sizzle with lemony brightness while the finish is dry and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2018 Mandelberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Notes of dried, crushed chamomile, dried lemon peel and earth are ethereal, fresh and insistent on this wine's nose. These aromas are joined by apple freshness on the slender but concentrated palate where they spread with their persistence and clarity. Dry and beautifully aromatic, the wine has a vein of acidity that lends poise.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2017 Osterberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though appropriately tense and stony on the nose, there's an approachable aspect of kumquat and honeysuckle on the nose of this bottling. The palate is full of citrusy freshness, delivering lemon and grapefruit-juice flavors against lush tones of gardenia and more honeysuckle.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Maidenstoen 2019 Zabala Vineyard Riesling (Arroyo Seco)

Description: Richness and texture are expressed in ripe pear and orange-zest notes on the nose of this wine. The palate continues the generous theme with a juicy and rounded body of peach and pear flavors, all made precise by full citrus freshness. It finishes dry and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Boeckel 2018 Wiebelsberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Hints of lemon appear shyly on this wine's nose. The palate comes in with equally restrained but beautiful apple notions. Both the freshness of red apple and the mellow ripeness of yellow apple make for a juicy, rounded and harmonious experience, with lots of verve and concentration. The finish is dry and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2018 Steinert Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Richness and texture are expressed in ripe pear and orange-zest notes on the nose of this wine. The palate continues the generous theme with a juicy and rounded body of peach and pear flavors, all made precise by full citrus freshness. It finishes dry and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Boeckel 2018 Wiebelsberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: On the nose of this wine, hints of lemon oil surround ripe, yellow-apple notes with their richness and insistence. Apple juiciness takes over on a concentrated, energetic palate that conveys rounded ripe but pervasive freshness. A slightly broad, dry finish brings mellow apple notes and beautiful length.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2018 Kirchberg de Ribeauville Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though appropriately tense and stony on the nose, there's an approachable aspect of kumquat and honeysuckle on the nose of this bottling. The palate is full of citrusy freshness, delivering lemon and grapefruit-juice flavors against lush tones of gardenia and more honeysuckle.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Maidenstoen 2019 Zabala Vineyard Riesling (Arroyo Seco)

Description: This wine is shy on the nose, giving just a mere hint of lemon and peach. Gentle but concentrated, the palate shows more of this peachy subtlety that tapers towards elegant concentration. Lemon echoes throughout this subtle but concentrated wine. The finish is dry and lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler 2018 Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: At first this wine shows yeasty, earthy funk followed by mellow creaminess that evokes apple crumble. That creaminess almost gets a lemon and apple yogurt note on the textured palate but bright, ripe lemon shines on the finish. A slightly rustic and unusual take on dry Riesling, it's compelling nonetheless.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2018 Kastelberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Only the faintest note of lemon can be made out on this wine's shy nose. Lemon ripeness, brightness and juiciness gets their due on a flowing, viviacious and sinuous body that is breezy with zest and gentle with blossomy ease, anchored by a mouthwatering, zesty core.The finish is dry and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2018 Vieilles Vignes Kaefferkopf Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Fresh, vivid, and totally primary notes of tangerine and mandarin peel play on this wine's charming nose. The palate fills out with generous notions of mandarin, orange, apple and peach, becoming a picture of concentrated, joyful juiciness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2019 Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: At first this wine shows yeasty, earthy funk followed by mellow creaminess that evokes apple crumble. That creaminess almost gets a lemon and apple yogurt note on the textured palate but bright, ripe lemon shines on the finish. A slightly rustic and unusual take on dry Riesling, it's compelling nonetheless.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2018 Kastelberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A subtle, ethereal note of crushed chamomile appears first on this wine's nose before ripe apple notes kick in. The palate is fresh with lemon brightness but also shows an apple-like, mellow texture. It has concentration and drive, with a mellow, dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2017 Furstentum Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Warm tones of seared lemon peel, crisp and dried apple and apple blossom show on the dynamic nose of this bottling, which comes from vines that are more than 45 years old. There's a flashy zing of acidity on the sip, where flavors of nectarine, Rainier cherry and chiseled sandstone cling to a relentlessly taut texture.                      Matt Kettmann
