Name: Maidenstoen 2019 Lafond Vineyard Riesling (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: Mellow yellow apple on this wine's nose signals ripeness. The rounded palate continues this theme, counterpointing it with lemon freshness that propels everything forward, culminating in a long, smooth and fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine François Schmitt 2018 Paradis Pfingstberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of lemon peel flash up here and there on the nose of this wine. The palate adds more roundness, with a hint of ripe pear juice, but keeps that lemon zestiness, a pulsating freshness that also carries some of 2018's heat. This wine is balanced, ripe, vibrant and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hubert Meyer 2018 Winzenberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: From high-altitude vineyards grown on the slopes of Mount Etna, this fragrant white has intense aromas of mimosa flower, citrus, white stone fruit and Mediterranean brush. Racy and delicious, the focused palate boasts great mineral tension, delivering apricot, Meyer lemon, apple and tangy mineral set against crisp acidity. This also offers good mid-term aging potential. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2018 Eruzione 1614 Riesling (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Some yeasty funk has to blow off before the green apple and lemon freshness of this wine can break through. On the palate the juiciness convinces, with bright, vivid freshness. Earthy notions anchor this in a pithy texture but the lemon wins over on the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2018 Wineck-Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Just a faint note of citrus freshness escapes from a glass of this otherwise shy wine. The palate of the dry, toned wine offers a concentrated core that shows notions of dried chamomile, dried lemon rind and juicy peach. Bitter pithiness emphasizes the concentration and lends texture.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine de la Tour Blanche 2017 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A whiff of passion fruit flashes on this wine's nose before it goes shy again. The palate presents ripe but bright lemon freshness, cushioned by gentle Mirabelle notes and presented in a concentrated, slender and perfectly proportioned body. A shy, understated Riesling, it has a dry, ripe but refreshing finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2018 Praelatenberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: A faint hint of petrol blends in with mellow apple and bright lemon notes on this wine's nose. Apple and lemon freshness is buffered on the creamy palate, helping make this dry wine juicy and vivid. The long finish recalls mellow apple.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Helfrich 2018 Steinklotz Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: This wine's shy nose gives little away, despite lively swirling. On the palate, the generous juiciness reminiscent of ripe, yellow apple and rounded lemon becomes apparent. The wine has energy and ease but also concentration and freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Robert Klingenfus 2018 Bruderthal Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine still hasn't fully settled in, showing reduction initially. Behind it are aromas of lime and wet slate. The palate brings mouthwatering, electric acidity to the supremely flavorful lemon-lime flavors. Decant if drinking in the immediate term.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Canvasback 2019 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Only subtle hints of dried lemon and something earthy escape on this wine's shy nose. The palate also is aromatically subdued but comes in with a creamy, rich and rounded body. A central vein of freshness brightens everything and lengthens the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Andre Lorentz 2018 Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Not quite fully dry, this skirts the border of off-dry with a touch of residual sugar, just enough to round out the tart grapefruit flavors that hold down the center palate. It opens further with more citrus and green apple fruit, underscored with refreshing minerality.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Foris 2019 Riesling (Rogue Valley)

Description: In this wine, subtle but bright lemon notes rise slowly from the glass. More swirling reveals riper peach and Mirabelle. The palate adds a rounded, mellow and almost creamy ripeness that broadens out the palate and makes for a dry but rich finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Specht 2018 Mandelberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Chamomile, dried lemon rind, apple and juicy Mirabelle unite, giving freshness, aroma and verve to the aromatic nose on this wine. On the slender palate these aromas are enlivened by bright, frothy fizz. Citrus and freshness dance as the bubbles burst. It's a lively and unusual sparkler with a dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2017 Brut Riesling (Crémant d'Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of flower, pear and lime leaf, initially seeming subdued but opening over time. The palate drinks bone dry, with the strong sense of acidity.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Januik 2018 Bacchus Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The shy nose on this wine gives a distant tropical hint of mango but not much more. The dry palate swings with freshness, concentration and juiciness, even if the fruit notions could be more precise. It is dry and fresh on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Jean-Luc Mader 2018 Rosacker Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of peach and summer blossom appear on this wine's gentle nose. The palate loses a bit of its focus and broadens out into a mellow texture, but freshness returns on the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar 2018 Florimont Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
Winery: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of mineral, dried rose petal, citrus and dried herb lead to just off dry Nestea flavors. There are lots of good things happening but the components aren't all entirely in harmony.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Sleight of Hand 2019 The Magician Evergreen Vineyard Riesling (Ancient Lakes)

Description: Exuberant aromas of orange rind, ginger and freshly peeled satsuma are followed by medium-sweet flavors and vibrant acidity. Rose petal notes linger on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pacific Rim 2019 J Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of tangerine peel, flower, dried rose petal and citrus are followed by sweet, full feeling citrus flavors and plenty of acidity. There's a lovely sense of balance to it all. Dried rose petal notes linger on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pacific Rim 2019 Sweet Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Generous aromas of honeysuckle, pear, dried rose petal and orange are followed by mandarin orange flavors and a floral finish. A dried rose note is a bit of distracting on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pacific Rim 2019 Dry Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Diesel, lime and green apple aromas are followed by sleek fruit flavors backed by tart, racy acidity. The acidity is lifted but it seems evolved for its age.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dunham 2017 Lewis Estate Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp aromas of lime pith and a hint of grass are tightly wound on the nose of this off-dry Riesling that should even enthuse those who prefer bone-dry. There is a light sweetness on the palate, where pear, apple and peach tones meet with a touch of petrol.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Debts and Lessons 2019 Zabala Vineyard Riesling (Monterey County)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This intense, deep and wonderfully complex wine offers delicious layers of apricot, honey and toasted almond that waft up from the glass, coat the mouth and linger long on the finish. It's a rare treat for special occasions, and will age nicely through at least 2030.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2019 Cluster Select Late Harvest Riesling (Anderson Valley)

Description: Dry, ripe and textured with bracing minerality, this bursts forth with lemon fruit, flesh and rind, along with the crystalline acidity that would imply. It's a dense, expressive style, more complex than just lemony, with penetration and focus. Will this age? Indefinitely. Is it terrific already? You bet. Drink now into the 2030s.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cave Spring 2018 Estate Cave Spring Vineyard Riesling (Beamsville Bench)

Description: In this vintage the grapes from 45-year-old Coury clone vines were completely botrytis infected, yielding this exceptional dessert wine. Honey, caramel, golden apples and highlights of cinnamon powder are supported by a perfect acid-sugar balance. This should age for another decade at least, and possibly twice that.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Martin Woods 2018 Hyland Vineyard Riesling (McMinnville)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from old vines with an average age of 37 years, this outstanding wine will show best if it's not over-chilled. Fermented entirely in stainless steel with a German yeast strain, it's smooth and supple, with rounded flavors of apples, citrus, pears and kumquats. The lengthy finish adds a streak of breakfast tea.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Montinore 2019 Almost Dry Riesling (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A perfect example of the off-dry style, this brings scents and flavors of honeysuckle and honeydew melon, moving into a midpalate with sweet nectarine and Cosmic Crisp apple fruit. It's high in acid but 18 g/l of residual sugar provides a delicious sweet-tart balance. Drink now or age it for up to a decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brigadoon 2019 Off-dry Riesling (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap-Marin County, North Coast, California, US
Description: Classic in style, this charming apricot and petrol-scented wine fills the palate with white peach and a touch of lemon-lime while good, nervy acidity wakes up the taste buds for another sip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2018 Chileno Valley Vineyard Riesling (Petaluma Gap-Marin County)

Description: The subtle nose on this wine alternates between citrus freshness and Golden Delicious roundness. Combining these two elements, the palate homes in on the juicy apple ripeness that brings a lovely, textured mellowness. The finish is dry and pervaded by lemon intensity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2018 Trois Châteaux Riesling (Alsace)

Description: Old vines anchor this estate-grown reserve wine. It's dry and fruity, riper and with more alcohol than the previous vintage, so more forward and accessible as a result. A mix of citrus fruit and lemon peel highlights fill the palate, with just a faint suggestion of gin-like botanical herbs. It's a fine effort, more suitable for near-term drinking than long-term cellaring.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cave Spring 2018 CSV Riesling (Beamsville Bench)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This will have plenty of appeal for those who enjoy a high-acid style. The searing tartness is somewhat mitigated by 8 g/l of residual sugar, just enough to round things off a bit. Dried apples, oranges, grapefruit and lemon-rind flavors give this exceptional density and complexity through a long finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brigadoon 2019 Dry Riesling (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Estate grown and medium dry (as the back label indicates), this is a complex weave of lemon juice, curd, dried apricot and orange peel. It tilts toward tartness, though rounded out just a bit with a dollop of residual sugar. With good balance and plenty of acid, it can age indefinitely, but should be in a prime drinking window for the next six to year years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2019 Estate Riesling (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Balance is the watchword for this wine, reaching across the dynamic tension between the residual fruit sugar and the searing acidity. In the mix are tangy flavors of apple, white melon, lemon and tangerine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cave Spring 2018 Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are vibrant, with notes of lime leaf, whole lime and wet slate. Medium-bodied, off-dry lime and white-peach flavors follow, with mouthwatering acidity upping the interest. Nestea Iced Tea notes linger on the finish. Delicious stuff. Pair it with shrimp ceviche with diced mango and lime juice.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle & Dr. Loosen 2018 Eroica Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Orange rind, light melon, slightly tropical tones and a wet gravel minerality show on the easy and likable nose of this bottling. There's a tactile grip and sharp acidity to the sip, which underlies otherwise full flavors of orange and kumquat.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lola 2018 The Artisanal Series Riesling (Monterey)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Flavors of ripe golden apples and nectarines, with a defining lick of pink grapefruit, set up this palate-perfect old-vine Riesling. At 12 g/l residual sugar it is still basically dry, but rounded off a bit. There is certainly the potential to age this, but the fresh fruit is awfully compelling. It finishes with a hint of bubblegum.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Argyle 2018 Nuthouse Riesling (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Dry and balanced, this is a fruit-driven wine with good aging potential. Tart apple, lemon, pineapple and peach flavors come together in a well-integrated whole, with snappy acids and excellent concentration.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Alexana 2019 Revana Vineyard Riesling (Dundee Hills)
